prehensio: <entryFree id="n38247" type="main" key="pre^hensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĕhensĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">prensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prehendo</etym>, <sense id="n38247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apprenending.</hi>—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (ante-class.): tribuni plebis prensionem habent, <hi rend="ital">the right of arresting any one</hi>, Atei. Cap. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 12, 4</bibl>: in magistratu habent alii vocationem, alii prensionem, Varr. ib. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 6</bibl>, the true reading is pressionibus).</sense></entryFree>
prehenso: <entryFree id="n38248" type="main" key="pre^henso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĕhenso</orth>, and more freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">prenso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay hold of</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n38248.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">prensare manu bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigia dextris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenaci forcipe ferrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubrica prensantes effugit umbra manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:476" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prehensare hostium tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38248.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to take hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detain</hi> a person, in order to talk with him, thank him, entreat him, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">arma, genua, vestigia prensando, flexere militum animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commanipularium pectora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque prenso amicos, supplico, ambio domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prensatas exeuntium manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38248.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to sue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solicit</hi> for an office: <cit><quote lang="la">circumire et prensare patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 7</bibl></cit>.—So <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prensat unus P. Galba,</quote> <trans><tr>solicits for the consulship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos initium prensandi facere cogitaramus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
prehensus: <entryFree id="n38249" type="main" key="pre^hensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĕhensus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from prehendo.</entryFree>
prelius: <entryFree id="n38250" type="main" key="Preli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prelĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prilĭus</orth> (Cod. Erf., Perelius) <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcus</orth>, <sense id="n38250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small lake in Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lago di Castiglione</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prelum: <entryFree id="n38251" type="main" key="pre_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prēlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prae-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>premo</etym>, <sense id="n38251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a press.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38251.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A press-beam</hi> for pressing grapes, olives, etc.; also, meton., <hi rend="ital">a wine-press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oil-press</hi> (class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cola prelorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 242</bibl></cit> (prela trabes sunt, quibus uva jam calcata premitur, Serv.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 317</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38251.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A press</hi> for smoothing clothes: <cit><quote lang="la">tua collucent prela lacernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:46:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 46, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:8:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 8, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prema: <entryFree id="n38252" type="main" key="Pre^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĕma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess presiding over newly-married persons</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 9, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
premo: <entryFree id="n38253" type="main" key="pre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĕmo</orth>, <itype>essi, essum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. prelum</etym>, <sense id="n38253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38253.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede pedem alicui premere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et trepidae matres pressere ad pectora natos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veluti qui sentibus anguem Pressit humi nitens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novercae Monstra manu premens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressit et inductis membra paterna rotis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>drove her chariot over her father's body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:366" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes Hymettiae Premunt columnas,</quote> <trans><tr>press</tr>, <tr>rest heavily upon them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">premere terga genu alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera plena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to milk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:769" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 769</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to tread in</tr>, <tr>to follow one's footsteps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudis pressit qui calcibus anguem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dente frena,</quote> <trans><tr>to bite</tr>, <tr>to champ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to chew</tr>, <tr>eat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:538" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 538</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">presso molari,</quote> <trans><tr>with compressed teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressum lac,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cheese</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 82</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hister Peucen premerat Antro,</quote> <trans><tr>forced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:256" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">feminas premunt galli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:57:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 57, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38253.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bear down upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to touch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">premere litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep close to the shore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to fly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:835" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 835</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hold fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmly grasp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">premere frena manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <trans><tr>to grasp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:670" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:615" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 615</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.5" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to press</hi> a place with one's body, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to sit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">seat one's self on</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">toros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quod premis habeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pictam positā pharetram cervice premebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:421" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum,</quote> <trans><tr>to lie on the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:844" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 844</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes tuo premis ore caducas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 650</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 510" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 510</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to conceal</hi> by covering (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid terrā,</quote> <trans><tr>to conceal</tr>, <tr>bury in the earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:33" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonumque prematur in annum,</quote> <trans><tr>kept back</tr>, <tr>suppressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne lucrum tenebris alta premebat humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa male pressa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>buried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 79, 81, § 191</bibl>; hence, <hi rend="ital">to crown</hi>, <cb n="PREM" /> <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut premerer sacrā lauro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molli Fronde crinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canitiem galeā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitrā capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:517" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 517</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 556</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">shape</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">by pressing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod surgente die mulsere horisque diurnis, Nocte premunt,</quote> <trans><tr>they make into cheese</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os fingit premendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollem terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 15, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:34" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.8" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press hard upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear down upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue closely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes de loco superiore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeiani nostros premere et instare coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac fugerent Graii, premeret Trojana juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergamenae naves cum adversarios premerent acrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc Rutulus premit, et murum circumsonat armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidione urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 32</bibl></cit>.—Of the pursuit or chase of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">ad retia cervum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumantis apri cursum clamore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestias venatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 10, 282</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.9" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescia quem premeret,</quote> <trans><tr>on whose back she sat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:869" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 869</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergum equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 343: et natat exuviis Graecia pressa suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:114" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 114</bibl></cit> (5, 1, 116): <cit><quote lang="la">pressae carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressus membra mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit> (3, 7), 42: <cit><quote lang="la">magno et gravi onere armorum pressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro phaleras,</quote> <trans><tr>to adorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:567" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 567</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.10" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(caprum) dentes in vite prementem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:355" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">presso sub vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 356</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">presso aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:161" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte ensem in corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:542" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nitidas presso pollice finge comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit> (4, 9), 14: <cit><quote lang="la">et cubito remanete presso,</quote> <trans><tr>leaning upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38253.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To make</hi> with any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aeternā notā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:610" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera articulo pressa tremente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multā via pressa rotā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:18:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.12" n="9" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to sink down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lower</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec preme, nec summum molire per aethera currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanaeque memor sortis, quae tollit eosdem, Et premit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus ut ad Scythiam Rhiphaeasque arduus arces Consurgit, premitur Libyae devexus in Austros,</quote> <trans><tr>sinks down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 240</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 155" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 155</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n38253.13" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38253.14" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgulta per agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 346</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.15" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">form by pressing down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dig</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigio leviter presso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">(trop.): vestigia non pressa leviter, sed fixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcum premere,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw a furrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossam transversam, inter montes pressit (al. percussit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossa pressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:69:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 69, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavernae in altitudinem pressae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.16" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To strike to the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strike down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres famulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.17" n="10" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueo collum,</quote> <trans><tr>to strangle</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angebar ceu guttura forcipe pressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">presso gutture,</quote> <trans><tr>compressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 410</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem unius praecordia pressit ille (boletus) senis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stopped his breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:621" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus illa premetur Per somnum digitis,</quote> <trans><tr>choked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:221" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplexu presso,</quote> <trans><tr>united</tr>, <tr>in close embrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 192" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula jungere pressa,</quote> <trans><tr>to exchange kisses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 94</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pressa basia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:34:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">presso gradu incedere,</quote> <trans><tr>in close ranks</tr>, <tr>foot to foot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede presso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.18" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38253.19" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To shorten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressis habenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 600</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laxas dure habenas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 63</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n38253.20" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To keep short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calenā falce vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriem falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 628</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falce premes umbras (i. e. arbores umbrantes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">molle salictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:110" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 110</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38253.21" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">premere sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia pressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attoniti pressere gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:424" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 424</bibl></cit>' dixit, pressoque obmutuit ore, <hi rend="ital">was silent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 155</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.22" n="11" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring out by pressure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenerā sucos pressere medullā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 318</bibl></cit>; cf.: (equus) collectumque fremens volvit sub naribus ignem, Verg. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:68" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 68</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:G. 3:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 85</bibl> Rib.—</sense><sense id="n38253.23" n="12" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To frequent</hi>: feci ut cotidie praesentem me viderent, habitavi in <pb n="1441" /> <cb n="PREM" /> oculis, pressi forum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 66</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n38253.24" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38253.25" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh down; to urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to press close</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego istum pro suis factis pessumis pessum premam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 49</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae necessitas eum tanta premebat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae premant, et ea, quae impendeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerumnae, quae me premunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressus gravitate soporis,</quote> <trans><tr>bound by heavy</tr>, <tr>deep sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aut aere alieno, aut magnitudine tributorum, aut injuriā potentium premuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia et odio populi premi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">premi periculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a me premeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:53:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem verbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminibus veris premere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a plerisque ad exeundum premeretur, exire noluit,</quote> <trans><tr>was pressed</tr>, <tr>urged</tr>, <tr>importuned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Pompeii procuratoribus sescentis premi coeptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: numina nulla premunt; <cit><quote lang="la">mortali urgemur ab hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 375</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">premere reum voce, vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <trans><tr>to pursue obstinately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confessionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to force a confession from one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum etiam atque etiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to pursue steadily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancipiti mentem formidine pressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maerore pressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oct. 103" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oct. 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritate pressus negare non potuit,</quote> <trans><tr>overcome</tr>, <tr>overpowered</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.26" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38253.27" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To repress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dum nocte premuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 827</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam sub corde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:62" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavorem et consternationem mentis vultu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interius omne secretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem silentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> cf. silentia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:646" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 646</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam te premet nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.28" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undervalue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disparage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depreciate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">premendorum superiorum arte sese extollebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma Latini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opuscula ( = deprimere atque elevare),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">premere ac despicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">premere tumentia, humilia extollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 10:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.29" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta premant annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne prisca vetustas Laude pudicitiae saecula nostra premat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum Latonia Nymphas Virgo premit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:115" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.30" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To rule</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dicione premere populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mycenas Servitio premet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 285</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.31" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To suppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pull down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degrade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (vocabula) nunc situs premit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec premendo alium me extulisse velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 59, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 41, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">premebat reum crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.32" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To compress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec enim, quae dilatantur a nobis, Zeno sic premebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38253.33" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum ingenii tui, Brute, premit haec importuna clades civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub imo Corde gemitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <trans><tr>to be silent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones vulgi,</quote> <trans><tr>to restrain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.34" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To store up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay up</hi> in the mind, <hi rend="ital">muse upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vocem) ab ore Eripuit pater ac stupefactus numine pressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 119</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38253.35" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Moderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppressed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kept down.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38253.36" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">presso pede eos retro cedentes principes recipiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">presso gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 14, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pressoque legit vestigia gressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.37" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38253.38" n="1" level="3"> Of the voice or manner, <hi rend="ital">subdued</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum pressis et flebilibus modis, qui totis theatris maestitiam inferant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.39" n="2" level="3"> Of color, <hi rend="ital">lowered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depressed;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color pressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color viridi pressior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 13, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spadices pressi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.40" n="II" level="1"> Esp., of an orator or of speech. </sense><sense id="n38253.41" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Compressed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without ornament</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fiunt pro grandibus tumidi, pressis exiles, fortibus temerarii, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Attici pressi et integri, contra Asiani inflati et inanes haberentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 18</bibl></cit>.—Of style: <cit><quote lang="la">pressa et tenuia, et quae minimum ab usu cotidiano recedant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressus et demissus stilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:117" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 117</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: in concionibus pressior, et circumscriptior, et adductior,<cb n="PRES" />  <hi rend="ital">more moderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeping more within bounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.42" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides ita verbis aptus et pressus, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 56</bibl></cit>: quis te fuit umquam in partiundis rebus pressior? <hi rend="ital">more exact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more accurate</hi>, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 364, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti taxare pressius crebriusque est, quam tangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (periculum) observandum pressiore cautelā censeo,</quote> <trans><tr>stricter</tr>, <tr>greater</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 160, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationes pressiores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 163, 32.—So of sounds, <hi rend="ital">precise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lingua) vocem profusam fingit atque sonos vocis distinctos et pressos facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pressē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with pressure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi> (class.): artius pressiusque conflictata, Atei. Capito ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 6, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.43" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tightly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38253.44" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites pressius putare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressius colla radere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.45" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38253.46" n="a" level="4"> Of pronunciation, <hi rend="ital">shortly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trimly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui non aspere, non vaste, non rustice, sed presse, et aequabiliter, et leniter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 37, 133</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.47" n="b" level="4"> Of the mode of expression, etc., <hi rend="ital">concisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not diffusely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">definire presse et anguste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 33, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abundanter dicere, an presse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressius et astrictius scripsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.48" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Without ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum (genus oratorum) attenuate presseque, alterum sublate ampleque dicentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:202" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 55, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid describere modo pressius, modo elatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38253.49" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi placet agi subtilius, et pressius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">definiunt pressius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anquisitius, et exactius pressiusque disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prendo: <entryFree id="n38254" type="main" key="prendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. prehendo.</entryFree>
prensatio: <entryFree id="n38255" type="hapax" key="prensa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prensātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prenso; v. prehenso</etym>, <sense id="n38255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soliciting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canvassing</hi> for an office: <cit><quote lang="la">praepropera prensatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prensio: <entryFree id="n38256" type="main" key="prensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prendo</etym>, <sense id="n38256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grasping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taking hold of</hi>: quoniam moribus majorum tribuni plebis prensionem haberent, <hi rend="ital">had the right</hi> or <hi rend="ital">office of seizure</hi>, Att. Cap. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prensito: <entryFree id="n38257" type="main" key="prensi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prensĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">catch hold of</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum Libitinam ipsam flentes omnes prensitarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prenso: <entryFree id="n38258" type="main" key="prenso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prenso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. prehenso.</entryFree>
prensorium: <entryFree id="n38259" type="gloss" key="prenso_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prensōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prendo</etym>, <sense id="n38259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mouse-trap</hi>: prensorium <foreign lang="greek">i/pos</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
prensus: <entryFree id="n38260" type="main" key="prensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from prehendo.</entryFree>
presbyter: <entryFree id="n38261" type="greek" key="presby^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">presbyter</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">presbu/teros</foreign>. <sense id="n38261.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an elder</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38261.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an elder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">presbyter</hi> in the Christian Church: <cit><quote lang="la">quid facit, exceptā ordinatione, episcopus, quod presbyter non faciat?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Evagr. Ep. 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Baptism. 17</bibl>; Hadr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Sat. 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 5, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
presbyteratus: <entryFree id="n38262" type="main" key="presby^te^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">presbytĕrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>presbyter</etym>, <sense id="n38262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a presbyter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of a priest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presbyterate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">priesthood</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">diaconatum, et presbyteratum ambire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl></cit>, n. 28.</sense></entryFree>
presbyterium: <entryFree id="n38263" type="greek" key="presby^te^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">presbytĕrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">presbute/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n38263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a presbytery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assembly of elders</hi>, August. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 116, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 4, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
presse: <entryFree id="n38264" type="main" key="presse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pressē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. premo, <sense id="n38264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pressicius: <entryFree id="n38265" type="gloss" key="pressi_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pressīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pressus</etym>, <sense id="n38265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pressed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pressim: <entryFree id="n38266" type="main" key="pressim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pressim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with pressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by pressing to one's self</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">me pressim deosculato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 121, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linteolo pressim agglutinato,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>closely pressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 128, 23.</sense></entryFree>
pressio: <entryFree id="n38267" type="main" key="pressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pressĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>premo</etym>. <sense id="n38267.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pressing down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pressure</hi> (only in Vitruvius): <cit><quote lang="la">pressio cacuminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38267.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the prop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fulcrum</hi> under a lever while the burden is raised, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 6</bibl>: pressio, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">u(pomo/xlion</foreign> appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
presso: <entryFree id="n38268" type="main" key="presso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">presso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>premo</etym>, <sense id="n38268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vomicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: pressatur pede pes, mucro mucrone, viro vir, Furius Antias ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres ad pectora pressant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera manibus pressanda,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be milked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:472" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 472</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera palmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvam pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 18: <cit><quote lang="la">molliter ubera ovium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Virg. 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PRET" /></sense></entryFree>
pressor: <entryFree id="n38269" type="gloss" key="pressor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pressor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>premo</etym>, <sense id="n38269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of hunter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
pressoriola: <entryFree id="n38270" type="main" key="presso_ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pressōrĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a repository</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> Reg. ad Virg. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pressorius: <entryFree id="n38271" type="main" key="presso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pressōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38271.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That serves for pressing</hi> grapes, olives, etc. (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pressoria vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38271.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pressōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a press</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exprimere in pressorio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pressule: <entryFree id="n38272" type="main" key="pressu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pressŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pressulus <sense id="n38272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pressulus: <entryFree id="n38273" type="main" key="pressu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pressŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n38273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [pressus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat pressed in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">compressed</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">ampulla pressula rotunditate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 346, 26</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pressŭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">while pressing on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">against</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to one's self</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">filium pressule saviata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 156, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacinia adhaerens pressule,</quote> <trans><tr>closely</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 254, 10.</sense></entryFree>
pressura: <entryFree id="n38274" type="main" key="pressu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pressūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>premo</etym>, <sense id="n38274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pressure</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n38274.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressura palpebrarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 166, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38274.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a pressing</hi> of wine, oil, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pressura una culeos viginti implere debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum primae pressurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38274.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38274.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pressure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">levare pressuram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 195, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38274.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throng</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi> of people: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia densitas pressurae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38274.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The downward pressure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descent</hi> of water, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 18" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38274.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A too heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">too long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unnatural sleep</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1 praef.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n38274.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That which is pressed out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">juice</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Corycii pressura croci, sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 809</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38274.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">oppression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affliction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distress</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pressuram persecutionemque perferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 22, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 26, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pressus: <entryFree id="n38275" type="main" key="pressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from premo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38276" type="main" key="pressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>premo</etym>, <sense id="n38276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pressure</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38276.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus intentione suā depellit pressum omnem ponderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38276.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: hic pressu duplici palmarum continet anguem, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 109: ipso oris pressu, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a proper pressure of the lips</hi>, so as not to pronounce too broadly, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prester: <entryFree id="n38277" type="greek" key="pre_ster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prēster</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prhsth/r</foreign> [burning]. <sense id="n38277.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fiery whirlwind</hi>, which descends in the form of a pillar of fire, <hi rend="ital">a water-spout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sand-spout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">presteras Graici quos ab re nominitarunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbo ardentior accensusque dum furit, prester vocatur, amburens contacta pariter, et proterens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 48, 50, § 133</bibl></cit>: spiritus cum majore vi torti sunt, fit procella terrestris, et a Graecis prester nomen accepit, App. de Mundo, p. 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n38277.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of serpent</hi>, whose bite causes a burning thirst: <cit><quote lang="la">prester quem percusserit, distenditur, enormique corpulentiā necatur extuberatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torridus prester,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 791</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:20:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 20, 81</bibl> § 210; 24, 13, 73, § 117.</sense></entryFree>
preti: <entryFree id="n38278" type="main" key="Preti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Preti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond the Ganges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pretio: <entryFree id="n38279" type="main" key="pre^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĕtĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pretium</etym>, <sense id="n38279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prize</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pretiose: <entryFree id="n38280" type="main" key="pre^ti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĕtĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pretiosus <sense id="n38280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pretiositas: <entryFree id="n38281" type="main" key="pre^ti^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĕtĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pretiosus</etym>, <sense id="n38281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">preciousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">costliness</hi> (very rare): anuli pretiositas, Atei. Capito ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pretiosus: <entryFree id="n38282" type="main" key="pre^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĕtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pretium</etym>, <sense id="n38282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of great value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valuable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38282.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subiitque argentea proles Auro deterior, fulvo pretiosior aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium quondam fuerat pretiosius auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res pretiosissimae (opp. vilissimae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 52, § 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretiosissimum humani animi opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 29, 30, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen haec loca sunt ullo pretiosa metallo,</quote> <trans><tr>rich in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:8:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38282.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38282.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of great cost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">costly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sordido vehiculo erubescit, pretioso gloriabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thais,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 43: <cit><quote lang="la">pretioso pretio emere aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>dear</tr>, <tr>high</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <trans><tr>which is satisfied at much expense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10</bibl></cit> 96, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia,</quote> <trans><tr>dearly bought</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:69:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 69, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albani veteris pretiosa senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:214" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 214</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38282.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That gives a great price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagant</hi>:<pb n="1442" /> <cb n="PRET" />  pretiosus emptor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 32</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prĕtĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a costly manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expensively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">richly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vasa pretiose caelata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 40, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretiose armatus exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:5:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretiosius sepeliri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pretium: <entryFree id="n38283" type="main" key="pre^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĕtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root par-, pana (for parna), wager, loan; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pi-pra/skw</foreign>, to sell; <foreign lang="greek">pri/amai</foreign>, to buy; cf. <foreign lang="greek">po/rnos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n38283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that for</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by which any thing is bought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sold</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38283.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">money</hi> spent for any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nil pretio parsit, filio dum parceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina ... urbem Exiguam pretio posuit,</quote> <trans><tr>for money has founded a small city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia parvo pretio redempta habere,</quote> <trans><tr>for little money</tr>, <tr>cheaply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretio mercari ordinem senatorium,</quote> <trans><tr>to purchase</tr>, <tr>to gain with money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:49:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permutare pretio noluit, aliāve merce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 55, 81, § 171</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38283.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wealth</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pretio pretium nunc est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">converso in pretium deo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>into a shower of gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38283.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">price.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38283.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: nec mi aurum posco nec mi pretium dederitis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 200 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">pretium statuere merci,</quote> <trans><tr>to set</tr>, <tr>fix</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium certum constituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enumerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacisci pro re aliquā,</quote> <trans><tr>to agree upon</tr>, <tr>settle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus hic pretiis porci veneunt?</quote> <trans><tr>at what prices are they sold here?</tr></trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendere aliquid pretio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parare sibi pretio aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi extulerunt eorum pretia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:6:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacent pretia praediorum,</quote> <trans><tr>are low</tr>, <tr>down</tr>, <tr>fallen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38283.5" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n38283.6" n="1" level="3"> In phrases: magni, parvi pretii esse, <hi rend="ital">to be high</hi> or <hi rend="ital">low in price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of much</hi> or <hi rend="ital">little worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of great</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of small value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus est tam parvi pretii, quin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tu habes servum graphicum, et quantivis pretii!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum majoris pretii nemo habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli spectare, quanti homo sit: parvi enim pretii est, qui jam nihil est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de illis potissimum jactura fit, quia pretii minimi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. ad Caes. 2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. ad Caes. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: pretium habere, <hi rend="ital">to have a value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be worth something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendat oleum, si pretium habeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annona porro pretium nisi in calamitate fructuum non habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl></cit>; but also: pretium habere, <hi rend="ital">to have a price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be for sale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis ignorat quin id longe sit liberalibus disciplinis dignissimum, non vendere operam: cum pleraque hoc ipso possint videri vilia, quod pretium habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; hence: pretium non habere, <hi rend="ital">to have no price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be above price</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse pretiosius, immo eum pretium non habere testatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 36:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 36, 8</bibl></cit>: in pretio esse, <hi rend="ital">to be of worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">estimation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in repute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum coquus in pretio esse (coeptus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec in pretio fertilis hortus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:316" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 316</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 22</bibl>: in pretio habere, <hi rend="ital">to regard as of value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in magno pretio habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 75, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum et argentum in pretio habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which cf.: pudebat libertatis majus esse apud feminas quam apud viros pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: pretium facere, <hi rend="ital">to fix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set a price</hi> or <hi rend="ital">value;</hi> of a seller: indica, fac pretium. <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Tua merx est; <cit><quote lang="la">tua indicatio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a purchaser: quis faceret pretium, nisi qui sua perdere vellet Omnia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:86:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 86, 7</bibl></cit>;
