<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:3:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 3, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38283.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Wages</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reward</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pro pretio facio ut opera appareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam Epidici nunc me emere pretio pretioso velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere alicui pro benefactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmae pretium victoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38283.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quales ex hac die experiundo cognovit, perinde operae eorum pretium faceret,</quote> <trans><tr>would estimate their services</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive aliquod morum Est pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 43</bibl></cit>: corticis etiam ad medicamenta pretium est, Plin, 12, 25, 54, § 118; 12, 19, 43, § 95.—</sense><sense id="n38283.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wages</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">price</hi> (cf.: stipendium, merces). </sense><sense id="n38283.10" n="1" level="3"> In a good sense: majores seorsum atque diversum pretium paravere bonis atque strenuis, decurionatus ... aliosque honores, Cato ap. <cb n="PRIA" /> Fest. s. v. optionatus, p. 201 Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">= praemium (opp. poena), ita et pretium recte facti triumphum haberet L. Paulus pro egregie bello gesto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 37, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pretium honoremque debito beneficio addat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pro cujusque merito consul pretia poenasque exsolvisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 40, 15</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis ampla pretia,</quote> <trans><tr>prizes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 43, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: tam longā valetudine conflictabatur, ut haec tanta pretia vivendi mortis rationibus vincerentur, <hi rend="ital">rewards of living</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">motives for living</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 4</bibl>.—Esp. in phrase pretium curae, and more freq. pretium operae, <hi rend="ital">a reward for trouble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi visum est pretium curae, ipsum, senatus consultum quaerere,</quote> <trans><tr>seemed to me worth the trouble</tr>, <tr>worth while</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est pretium curae cognoscere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:474" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 474</bibl></cit>: facturusne operae pretium sim, etc.,... nec satis scio, <hi rend="ital">what will pay for the trouble</hi>, Liv. praef.: <cit><quote lang="la">operae pretium habent libertatem, civitatemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:25:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:21:43" default="NO">21, 43</bibl>: audire est operae pretium, etc., Enn. ap. Acron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 37</bibl> (Ann. v. 454 Vahl.); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 7</bibl>: reddere opis pretium pro factis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108</bibl> (Epigr. v. 6 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quo in genere est operae pretium diligentiam majorum recordari,</quote> <trans><tr>it is worth while</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captā urbe, operae pretium fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 81:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 81, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so without operae (post-Aug.): Germanico pretium fuit convertere agmen,</quote> <trans><tr>thought it of importance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni pretium foret Pisonis sententias noscere,</quote> <trans><tr>were it not worth while</tr>, <tr>were it not of importance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse eum, si operae pretium faciat, principem popularium esse,</quote> <trans><tr>if he does any thing worth while</tr>, <tr>any thing of importance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 30</bibl></cit>: duos servos ad hostes transfugisse et operae pretium fecisse, <hi rend="ital">have done valuable service</hi>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptor minime utilis, cujus libro adtingere nullum pretium operae sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">operis pretium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:45" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38283.11" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense (i. q. poena), <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi>, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">timh/, misqo/s</foreign> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): si malos imitabor, tum pretium pro noxā dabis, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 365, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera, compedes, molae ... haec pretia sunt ignaviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego pretium ob stultitiam fero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et peccare nefas, aut pretium est mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille crucem pretium sceleris tulit, hic diadema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:105" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 105</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">bribery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adduci pretio ad hominem condemnandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caecil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretio judicem corrumpere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prece, nec pretio a rectā viā deduci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prex: <entryFree id="n38284" type="main" key="prex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prex</orth>, <itype>prĕcis</itype> (<case>nom.</case> and <sense id="n38284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> not in use; <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> only ante-class.; most freq. in <number>plur.</number>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>precor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a prayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreaty</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38284.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc te oro per precem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est preci loci relictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prece te oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multā prece prosequi aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magnā prece ad aliquem scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prece et obsecratione humili ac supplici uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:16:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prece, nec pretio, nec gratiā, nec simultate a rectā viā deduci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus precibus te oro et obtestor, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 11</bibl></cit>, A, § <cit><quote lang="la">3: omnibus precibus petere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigare aliquem precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus flecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adduci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad miseras preces Decurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 59</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38284.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38284.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A prayer</hi> to a deity: <cit><quote lang="la">in prece totus eram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:251" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum preces et vota exaudiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota et preces repudiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 70, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuunt ei successus petitionum a potestatibus, et a diis etiam precum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 19, § 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38284.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A good wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly greeting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis Kalendis damus alternas accipimusque preces,</quote> <trans><tr>exchange good wishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:176" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38284.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A curse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprecation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus precibus detestatus Ambiorigem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misit Thyesteas preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:86" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostili caput prece detestari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 505</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38284.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An intercession</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">jam prece Pollucis, jam Castoris imploratā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
priamus: <entryFree id="n38285" type="main" key="Pri^a^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pri/amos</foreign>. <sense id="n38285.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Laomedon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband of Hecuba</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Hector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Helenus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Paris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Deiphobus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Polyxena</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cassandra</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">he</hi> <cb n="PRID" /> <hi rend="ital">was slain by Neoptolemus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Pyrrhus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Achilles</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 607</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 17 Vahl.): o pater, o patria, o Pria. mi domus! id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag v. 118 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 458</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 50 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:404 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 404 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:258" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 258</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 89" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 89</bibl> and 90.—</sense><sense id="n38285.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">His grandson</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named after him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Polites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 564</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38285.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭă-mēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*priamhi+/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Priam's daughter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atrides visā Priameide,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cassandra</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priameida viderat ipsam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 405</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38285.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭămēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*priamh/i+os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Priam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo Cassandra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hecuba</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Paris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: heros, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Hector</hi>, Auct. Pan. ad Pison. 162.—</sense><sense id="n38285.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prīămĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*priami/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a son of Priam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priamiden Helenum regnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priamides Deiphobus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quas Priamides in aquosae vallibus Idae Contulit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Paris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deploratos Priamidas,</quote> <trans><tr>Priam's sons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 482</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
priantae: <entryFree id="n38286" type="main" key="Pri^antae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭantae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thracian people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
priapeius: <entryFree id="n38287" type="main" key="Pri^a_pe_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭāpēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Priapus, C.</entryFree>
priapiscus: <entryFree id="n38288" type="greek" key="pri^a_piscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĭāpiscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">priapi/skos</foreign>, <sense id="n38288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant which excited passion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fool-stones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orchis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> satyrion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
priapismus: <entryFree id="n38289" type="greek" key="pri^a_pismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĭāpismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">priapismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n38289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a morbid excitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">priapism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
priaponnesus: <entryFree id="n38290" type="main" key="Pri^a_ponne_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭāponnēsus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pria/pou nh=sos</foreign>, <sense id="n38290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Caria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 36, § 134</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
priapus: <entryFree id="n38291" type="main" key="Pri^a_pus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭāpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pri/apos</foreign>, <sense id="n38291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Priapus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the god of Procreation;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">of gardens and vineyards</hi>, where his statues were placed, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:108" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 108</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 347</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:415" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 415</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:316" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 316</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 18, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 15, 13</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n38291.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38291.2" n="1" level="3"> Priapus vitreus, <hi rend="ital">a drinking-vessel of obscene shape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">siligineus,</quote> <trans><tr>a cake of the same shape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:69" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 60</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n38291.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A lecherous person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 47, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 32</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38291.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭāpēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Priapus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Priapian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 512</bibl></cit> P.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭāpēĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. carmina), <hi rend="ital">a collection of poems upon Priapus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by various authors.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38292" type="main" key="Pri^a_pus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭāpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n38292.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Mysia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Hellespont</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 141</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38292.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island near Ephesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
priaticuscampus: <entryFree id="n38293" type="main" key="Priaticus Campus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Priaticus Campus</orth>, <sense id="n38293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place near Maronea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pridem: <entryFree id="n38294" type="main" key="pri_dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīdem</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>from the obsol. pri-, prei-, (= prae; whence prior, primus, pridie), with demonstrative suffix dem</etym>, <sense id="n38294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">long ago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long since</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a long time ago;</hi> without a <hi rend="ital">negative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me pridem facere atriensem voluerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad me pridem scripseras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:680" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 680</bibl>.—With a <hi rend="ital">negative</hi>: non pridem, haud pridem, <hi rend="ital">not long ago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a short time ago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lately</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ego mali non pridem inveni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recens natura est mundi, neque pridem exordia cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ita pridem,</quote> <trans><tr>not so very long ago</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Themistocles fuit, nostrā civitate non ita pridem dominatu regio liberatā,</quote> <trans><tr>not long before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 10, 41</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">In old times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in former times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in time past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aforetime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc jam non classem, in quam, sicuti pridem, confugiant, superesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:7:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam notiorem sibi nunc, quam pridem fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem igitur furore in paenitentiam, quo pridem in iram versus, mori voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: quam pridem, <hi rend="ital">how long ago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for how long a time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam pridem pater et mater mortui essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam pridem non edisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:48:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 48, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pridianus: <entryFree id="n38295" type="main" key="pri_di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pridie</etym>, <sense id="n38295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the day before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that happened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was used</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eaten</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">the day before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yesterday's</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pridiana ac semesa opsonia apposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balinea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 77, § 248</bibl></cit>: reliquiae, Cat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 277, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluvia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 196, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 260, 19. <pb n="1443" /> <cb n="PRIM" /></sense></entryFree>
pridie: <entryFree id="n38296" type="main" key="pri_di^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīdĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>from the obsol. pri (whence prior, primus, pridem) and dies</etym>. <sense id="n38296.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">on the day before</hi> (class.; opp. postridie).— Constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> of the day from which the reckoning was made, or with <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> (class.); also, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (class. only in the phrase pridie ejus diei). </sense><sense id="n38296.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui cum pridie frequentes essetis assensi, postridie ad spem estis inanem pacis devoluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die tropaeum posuit, quo loco pridie pugnatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pridie asservata materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 26, § 104</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38296.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hic pridie natus foret, quam hic est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pridie quam ego Athenas veni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec epistula est pridie data quam illa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38296.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pridie ejus diei,</quote> <trans><tr>on the day before this day</tr>, <tr>the day before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the day before the ambush</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38296.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case>, designating the day (v. Madvig. § <cit><quote lang="la">230, obs. 1): pridie Idus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Compitalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quinquatrus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum diem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circenses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitutam diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum diem, Fest. s. v. Regillis, p. 286 Müll.: vindemias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequinoctium autumnale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:19:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38296.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, the phrase pridie Kalendas (Nonas, etc.) is used as a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in Formiano esse volumus usque ad pridie Nonas Maias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ante diem III. Non. Jun. usque ad prid. Kal. Sept.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gignit id maxime arcturi exortus ex a. d. pridie Idus Septembris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 15, § 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: EX. A. D. V. KAL. DEC. AD PR. KAL. JAN. SEXT., <hi rend="ital">for six years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the</hi> 31<hi rend="ital">st December</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 594</bibl>: litterarum datarum pridie Kal. Januar. suavem habuit recordationem clarissimi jurisjurandi, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> 31<hi rend="ital">st of December</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 22</bibl>.—With an <case>acc.</case>, not designating a day: <cit><quote lang="la">quod uxorem pridie sortitionem ductam postridie repudiasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Roth (Oud. sortitione).—</sense><sense id="n38296.6" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a short time before</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:83:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 83, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Psyche, non ita, ut pridie, parvula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
priene: <entryFree id="n38297" type="main" key="Pri^e_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prih/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n38297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maritime town of lonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Bias</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Samsoon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures esse, Bias, pravos, quem clara Priene, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> VII. Sap. Lud. 11</bibl></cit>, and Biant. 1.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38297.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭēnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prihnai=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Priene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Prienian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 161</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38297.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭēnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Priene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scammonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 38, § 60</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭ-ēnenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Priene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Prienians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38297.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prĭēneus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prihneu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Priene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Prienian; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Prienian</hi>: Bias Prieneus dixit, <foreign lang="greek">oi( plei=stoi kakoi/</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> VII. Sap. Lud. 11</bibl>, and Biant. 1.</sense></entryFree>
prilius: <entryFree id="n38298" type="main" key="Prili^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prilĭus Lăcus</orth>, <sense id="n38298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small lake in Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now Lago di Castiglione</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primaevitas: <entryFree id="n38299" type="main" key="pri_maevi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmaevĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>primaevus</etym>, <sense id="n38299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first period of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">youth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 462, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primaevus: <entryFree id="n38300" type="main" key="pri_maevus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmaevus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> [primus-aevum, <sense id="n38300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the first period of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">youthful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">primaevus Helenor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:570" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix primaevus eras, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Cons. Stil. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 345</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 562</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:653" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recepisti primaevus originis tuae florem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
primanus: <entryFree id="n38301" type="main" key="pri_ma_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primus</etym>, <sense id="n38301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the first legion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primanus tribunus apud Catonem ...,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=235" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 235</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: primanus tribunus erat, qui primae legioni tributum scribebat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=235" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 235</bibl> ib. (acc. to Mommsen: qui primam legionem tributim scribebat; v. Becker, Antiq. 3, 2, p. 131).—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">soldiers of the first legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primarius: <entryFree id="n38302" type="main" key="pri_ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the first rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remarkable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">primarius parasitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad primarius vir dicat,</quote> <trans><tr>the first speaker</tr>, <tr>he who has a right to be heard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primarius vir populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PRIM" /> 43, 45, § <cit><quote lang="la">139.—Of things: condicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ea, quae primario loco sunt, sed ea, quae secundum locum obtinent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 52</bibl></cit> dub. (B. and K. priore loco; Madvig. conj.: primo ordine; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Madvig. ad loc.): lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
primas: <entryFree id="n38303" type="main" key="pri_mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>primus</etym>, <sense id="n38303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the first</hi> or <hi rend="ital">principal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">apud primatem feminam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primatis civitatis filius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 124, 35 (Oud. principum): <cit><quote lang="la">notitia primatium urbium, Cod. Th. 7, 18, 13: periculo primatum officii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primatus: <entryFree id="n38304" type="main" key="pri_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>primas</etym>, <sense id="n38304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pre-eminence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">primacy</hi> (ante-class. and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">alii dant primatum bonis pratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primatum obtinere apud regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donare aliquem primatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:79" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 12, 24, § 79</bibl> (opp. secundatus).</sense></entryFree>
prime: <entryFree id="n38305" type="main" key="pri_me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. primus <sense id="n38305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> C.</sense></entryFree>
primiceriatus: <entryFree id="n38306" type="main" key="pri_mi^ce_ri^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭcērĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>primicerius</etym>, <sense id="n38306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a chief</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 12, 27, 1.</sense></entryFree>
primicerius: <entryFree id="n38307" type="main" key="pri_mi^ce_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭcērĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>primus - cera; whose name stands first on the wax-coated tablets; hence</etym>, <sense id="n38307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first</hi> among those holding a similar office, <hi rend="ital">a chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintendent</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">primicerius in officio Praefectorum Praetorio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protectorum,</quote> <trans><tr>of the guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: notariorum, <hi rend="ital">the chancellor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chief of the secretaries</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 18, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">sacri cubiculi,</quote> <trans><tr>the head-chamberlain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 28, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
primiformis: <entryFree id="n38308" type="hapax" key="pri_mi^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primus - forma</etym>, <sense id="n38308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the primary form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi>, Mar. Victor. p. 2533 P.</sense></entryFree>
primigenius: <entryFree id="n38309" type="main" key="pri_mi^ge^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭgĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primusgeno, gigno</etym>. <sense id="n38309.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">First of all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first of its kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi>, <hi rend="ital">primitive</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pecuaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminis fontes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>radical words</tr>, <tr>primitives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=36" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 36</bibl></cit> Müll.: primigenius sulcus dicitur, qui in condendā novā urbe tauro et vaccā designationis causā imprimitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=236" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 236</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n38309.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38309.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭgĕnĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the first principle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 10, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38309.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prīmĭgĕ-nĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of the Phrygians</hi>, who claimed to be the first men, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 259, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38309.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prīmĭgĕnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Fortuna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the attendant of her favorite from birth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 36, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 53, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primigenus: <entryFree id="n38310" type="main" key="pri_mi^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">first of all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dies primigenus maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
primipara: <entryFree id="n38311" type="main" key="pri_mi^pa^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭpăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>primus-pario</etym>, <sense id="n38311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that has brought forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foaled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whelped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">littered</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">for the first time;</hi> of animals (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 62, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:187" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 47, 72, § 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 210</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
primipilaris: <entryFree id="n38312" type="main" key="pri_mi^pi_la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭpīlāris</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmōpīlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primipilus</etym>. <sense id="n38312.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the first maniple of the</hi> triarii, <hi rend="ital">primipilar</hi> (postAug.): honor primipilaris, Fragm. Jur. Rom. Vat. 278 Huschke.—</sense><sense id="n38312.1" n="2" level="3"> (V<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:II. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> II. 2</bibl>. infra.) <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a commissary</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 58, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38312.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭpīlāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. centurio), <hi rend="ital">the captain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">centurion of this company</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cessit primipilari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 18:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamenta primipilarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 517</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">748</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3568</bibl>; Fragm. Jur. Rom. Vat. 141; 143 Huschke.—</sense><sense id="n38312.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38312.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">One who has been</hi> primipilaris, <hi rend="ital">an ex-primipilar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38312.5" n="2" level="3"> (Post-Aug.) <hi rend="ital">A commissary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:38:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 38, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:5:18:section=24" default="NO">50, 5, 18, § 24</bibl>; Cod. Th. 8, 4, 6. —</sense><sense id="n38312.6" n="3" level="3"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a bishop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclamatissimus primipilaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
primipilarius: <entryFree id="n38313" type="main" key="pri_mi^pi_la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭpīlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, i. q. primipilaris, <sense id="n38313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the centurion of the first maniple of the</hi> triarii (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Jul. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nig. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primipilatus: <entryFree id="n38314" type="main" key="pri_mi^pi_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭpīlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of chief centurion of the</hi> triarii, <hi rend="ital">the primipilate</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 63, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primipilum: <entryFree id="n38315" type="main" key="pri_mi^pi_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭpīlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of chief centurion of the</hi> triarii (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 799, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primipilus: <entryFree id="n38316" type="main" key="pri_mi^pi_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭpīlus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmōpīlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 2. pilus. <cb n="PRIM" /></entryFree>
primipotens: <entryFree id="n38317" type="main" key="pri_mi^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primus-potens</etym>, <sense id="n38317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first in power</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus primipotens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 92, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
primiscrinius: <entryFree id="n38318" type="main" key="pri_mi_scri_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmīscrīnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>primus-scrinium</etym>, <sense id="n38318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief of an official department</hi> or <hi rend="ital">college</hi> (post - class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 50, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2953</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primiter: <entryFree id="n38319" type="main" key="pri_mi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. primus <sense id="n38319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> D.</sense></entryFree>
primitiae: <entryFree id="n38320" type="main" key="pri_mi^ti^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭtĭae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭcĭae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>primus</etym>, <sense id="n38320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first things of their kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firstlings.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38320.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">first-fruits</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primitias Cereri farra resecta dabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:520" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 520</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 2, 2, § 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomiferi Laribus consuevimus horti Mittere primitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:2:64" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 2, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:22:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 22, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38320.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">primitiae metallorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the first produce of the mine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <trans><tr>the first shoots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:10:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 147</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38320.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">primitiae juvenis miserae,</quote> <trans><tr>his first unhappy essays</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tori,</quote> <trans><tr>the first nuptial joys</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:111" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the first-fruits of war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:285" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primitiae et quasi libamenta ingenuarum artium, Gell. praef.: spectaculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatus,</quote> <trans><tr>the beginning of navigation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 765 Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">dormientium,</quote> <trans><tr>the first to rise from the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 15, 20</bibl></cit>; 15, 23.</sense></entryFree>
primitivus: <entryFree id="n38321" type="main" key="pri_mi^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first</hi> or <hi rend="ital">earliest of its kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">primitive</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <trans><tr>that blossom first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <trans><tr>the first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38321.1" n="B" level="2"> Gram. t. t. (for the class. primigenius, nativus): <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>primitives</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 824</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n38321.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the first-born</hi>: fetus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 828: <cit><quote lang="la">primitivum in pecoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primitivo suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 Reg. 16, 34</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiae in Christo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 16, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
primitus: <entryFree id="n38322" type="main" key="pri_mi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the first time</hi> (ante- and post-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): primitu', Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 154, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primitus cum exit vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primitus oritur herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 490</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 19, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primitus enim ex libamentis deos placabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde atque si primitus Latine fictum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:18:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primivirgius: <entryFree id="n38323" type="gloss" key="pri_mi^virgi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭvirgĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>primus-virga</etym>, <sense id="n38323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who carries the rod first before the king</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head verger</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">prwtorabdou=xos</foreign>, primivirgius, Gloss. Gr. Lat.: primivirgius, caballarius, quod primus est militiae in virgis, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
primo: <entryFree id="n38324" type="main" key="pri_mo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. primus <sense id="n38324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
primocreatus: <entryFree id="n38325" type="main" key="pri_mo_cre^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmōcrĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primuscreo</etym>. <sense id="n38325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">first-created</hi>: primogenitus, non primocreatus, Ambros. de Fide, 1, 7, 48.</sense></entryFree>
primogenitalis: <entryFree id="n38326" type="main" key="pri_mo_ge^ni^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmōgĕnĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primogenitus</etym>, <sense id="n38326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first of all as to origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primogenitus: <entryFree id="n38327" type="main" key="pri_mo_ge^ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmōgĕnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primusgenitus</etym>, <sense id="n38327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">first-born</hi> (post-Aug. for maximus natu, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 40, 95, § 234</bibl> (al. primis genitis): <cit><quote lang="la">vitulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primogenita omnia deo offerenda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 2</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmōgĕnĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the right of the first-born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">birthright</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:25:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 25, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 7:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primopilus: <entryFree id="n38328" type="main" key="pri_mo_pi_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmōpīlus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmōpīlāris</orth>, v. primip-.</entryFree>
primoplastus: <entryFree id="n38329" type="main" key="pri_moplastus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmoplastus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> [vox hibr., from primus - <foreign lang="greek">plasto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n38329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first - created</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primordia: <entryFree id="n38330" type="main" key="pri_mordi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmordĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. primordius.</entryFree>
primordialis: <entryFree id="n38331" type="main" key="pri_mordi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmordĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primordia</etym>, <sense id="n38331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is first of all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi>, <hi rend="ital">primordial</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmordĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">from the beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originally</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in regiones suas, unde primordialiter exsistunt, corpore naturaliter feruntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Mamert. Stat. Anim. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primordium: <entryFree id="n38332" type="main" key="pri_mordi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmordĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. primordius.</entryFree>
primordius: <entryFree id="n38333" type="main" key="pri_mordi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmordĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primus-ordior</etym>, <sense id="n38333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">original</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">primordii seminis mistu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 7</bibl></cit> dub. (al. primordiis seminum).—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmor-dĭum</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, and more usually <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prī-mordĭa</orth> (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> not in use; principiorum takes its place, Munro ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 262</bibl>; separated and transposed, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭa prīma</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 28</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n38333.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The first beginnings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement</hi> (class.; syn.: principium, initium): primordia rerum, Cic. Part. <pb n="1444" /> <cb n="PRIM" /> 2, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">a Jove Musarum primordia, id. poët. Leg. 2, 3, 7: mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterum vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquieta a primordiis vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 12, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17" default="NO">17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 29, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primordiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: a primordio urbis, Liv. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in operum suorum primordio stare,</quote> <trans><tr>in the first beginning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam tenues primordio imperi fuere fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38333.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">the beginning of a new reign</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primoris: <entryFree id="n38334" type="main" key="pri_mo_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmōris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n38334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> not in use), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi> (class. in <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n38334.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>the front teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primore pueritiā,</quote> <trans><tr>in earliest childhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:19:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <trans><tr>first</tr>, <tr>earliest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:511" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 511</bibl></cit>: primori Marte, <hi rend="ital">in the first part</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beginning of the war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primore aspectu,</quote> <trans><tr>at first sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38334.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38334.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The foremost part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forepart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremity</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. primus): sumere aliquid digitulis primoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>with the tips of one's fingers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versabatur mihi (nomen) in labris primoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>is at my tongue's end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid primoribus labris attingere,</quote> <trans><tr>to touch slightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 12, 28</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 428, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculum primorem praeacuito obliquum primores digitos duos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 3</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 427, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eduxique animam in primoribu' naribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 427, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasi primoris acumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pilo) primori inest pyxis ferrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:99" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 33, 51, § 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda late fusa primori parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 54, 80, § 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibulum esse partem domus primorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primore libro,</quote> <trans><tr>at the beginning of the book</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque in primores manus ac prope in digitos,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as the forepart of the hands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primori in acie versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38334.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The first</hi> in rank or dignity, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postclass.—In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20, 13</bibl>, Weissenb. reads: inpigre conscriptā; v. also Madvig. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 52</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Argivorum viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <trans><tr>chief</tr>, <tr>cardinal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmō-res</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n38334.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The front rank</hi> in battle, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum inter primores promptius dimicat, sagittā ictus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38334.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The men of the first rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the chiefs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nobles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patricians</hi> (cf. princeps): <cit><quote lang="la">Amphitruo delegit viros primorum principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio alienae honestatis ereptus primoribus ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primores populi arripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatum primores atque optimates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primores, ac duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex primoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 8, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primoticus: <entryFree id="n38335" type="main" key="pri_mo_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmōtĭcus</orth>, v. primotinus.</entryFree>
primotinus: <entryFree id="n38336" type="main" key="pri_mo_ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmōtĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primus</etym>, <sense id="n38336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that grows first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">early</hi> (opp. serotinus; <cit><quote lang="la">postclass.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit> (al. primotica).</sense></entryFree>
primulum: <entryFree id="n38337" type="main" key="pri_mu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmŭlum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. primulus.</entryFree>
primulus: <entryFree id="n38338" type="main" key="pri_mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n38338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [primus], <hi rend="ital">the first</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">primulo diluculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 105</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmŭlum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">at first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
primum: <entryFree id="n38339" type="main" key="pri_mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. primus <sense id="n38339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
primus: <entryFree id="n38340" type="main" key="pri_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n38340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. sup.</hi> [obsol. <pos>prep.</pos> pri (prei); whence also prior, priscus; cf.: privus, privo, etc., and v. pro], <hi rend="ital">the first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi> (properly only when three or more are referred to. The first, as opp. to the second, is prior; <cit><quote lang="la">but primus is rarely used for prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:44 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 19, 44 al.</bibl></cit>). </sense><sense id="n38340.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui primus vulnus dicitur obligavisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus sentio mala nostra: primus rescisco omnia: Primus porro obnuntio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum primum: verum igitur et extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primae litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author>
