Att. 9, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus inter homines nobilissimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primi ex omnibus philosophis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus Graeciae in Thraciam introiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus de mille fuisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primis,</quote> <trans><tr>among the first</tr>, <tr>in the foremost ranks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primis stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primis pugnantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 6</bibl></cit>: leonem <cb n="PRIM" /> primus, aut in primis ferire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 6, 1</bibl>: utque pedum primis infans vestigia plantis institerat (= ut primum, etc., <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 573</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus post eos quos poëtae tradiderunt movisse aliqua circa rhetoricen Empedocles dicitur (= secundus or proximus ab iis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38340.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38340.3" n="A" level="2"> In time or place, <hi rend="ital">first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foremost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the first part;</hi> sometimes to be translated, <hi rend="ital">the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremity</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in primā provinciā,</quote> <trans><tr>at the entrance of the province</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitus,</quote> <trans><tr>the tip of the finger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>the front teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 11, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranis prima lingua cohaeret,</quote> <trans><tr>the end of the tongue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primā statim nocte,</quote> <trans><tr>at the beginning of the night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:190" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the rising sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the new moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 13, 10, § 56</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quisque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the first possible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the very first</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo quoque tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>at the very first opportunity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 57, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo quoque die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me tibi primum quidque concedente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluit voluptas et prima quaeque avolat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 106</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the first part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the beginning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bellum, si prima satis prospera fuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the first principles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elements</hi> of things, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima consiliorum (for prima consilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: a primo, <hi rend="ital">from the beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at first</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum improbiores sunt quam a primo credidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illā pro Ctesiphonte oratione submissius a primo: deinde pressius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam vim retinere a primo ad extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:13:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc a primo cogitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:30:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 30, 75</bibl> Halm ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">id a primo rectissime dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit> Madv. ad loc.: in primo, <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites in primo late ire jubet,</quote> <trans><tr>in the van</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 68, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui numerus in primo viget, jacet in extremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:215" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64, 215</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38340.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">First</hi> in rank or station, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps, primores): evocat ad se Massiliensium quindecim primos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui municipii facile primus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primis urbis placuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum primi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est genus hominum, qui esse primos se omnium rerum volunt Nec sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia sum apud te primus,</quote> <trans><tr>I am the first in your favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus humani generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:255" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem Italiae primam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavia prima habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to give the first place to</tr>, <tr>think the most of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium atque divitiae, quae prima mortales putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <trans><tr>a chief part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 25, 21, § 88</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">most conspicuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, in a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatores, quorum primus ego sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primas partes, or primas agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to play the first part</tr>, <tr>to occupy the first rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primas in causis agebat Hortensius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:308" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90, 308</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">47</bibl>: primas dare, <hi rend="ital">to give the first place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascribe the greatest importance to</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">actioni primas dedisse Demosthenes dicitur, cum rogaretur, quid in dicendo esset primum: huic secundas, huic tertias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:56:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 56, 213</bibl></cit>: primas deferre, <hi rend="ital">to transfer the first</hi> or <hi rend="ital">principal part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris erga me tibi primas defero,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I assign to you the first rank among those who love me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: primas concedere, <hi rend="ital">to yield the first place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Allienus tibi primas in dicendo partes concesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primas tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>to play the first part</tr>, <tr>be the best</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:327" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 327</bibl></cit>: cum primis, and in primis (also written in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">impri-mis</orth>), <hi rend="ital">with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among the first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chiefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particularly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo domi suae cum primis locuples,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primis lautus eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum in primis Siciliae clarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:35:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 35, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in primis improbissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">68: vir magnus in primis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:43:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 43, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primis hoc a se animadversum esse dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primis nobis sermo de te fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primis ... dein,</quote> <trans><tr>first</tr>, <tr>in the first place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 26, 3</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, primo and primum; also, ante- and post-class. and very rare, prime and primiter (the form primo is usually limited to that which is strictly first in <cb n="PRIN" /> time; primum in enumerations of contemporary facts, things, or arguments, where the order is at the speaker's choice; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 920 sq.). </sense><sense id="n38340.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">at first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firstly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38340.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes primo ruere rebamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque credebam primo mihimet Sosiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo non accredidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Themistocles solus primo profectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptus est primo a tyrannis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Thras. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ham. 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38340.7" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dein</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deinde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mox</hi>, <hi rend="ital">denique</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nunc</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo Stoicorum more agamus, deinde nostro instituto vagabimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo pecuniae, dein imperii cupido crevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo ... deinde ... tum ... tum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo ... deinde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:21" default="NO">4, 16, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:11" default="NO">9, 10, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo abstinentiā utendum: deinde danda, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo ... inde, ... hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec primo paulatim crescere: post, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissuadente primo Vercingetorige, post concedente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo ... postea ... postremo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo ... mox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo ... mox deinde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo negitare, denique saepius fatigatus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 111:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 111, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illi credebam primo, nunc vero palam est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38340.8" n="3" level="3"> (Mostly post-Aug. for primum.) With <hi rend="ital">iterum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rursus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secundo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo ... iterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo ... rursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo ... secundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 10, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38340.9" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">at first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the first place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the beginning</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38340.10" n="1" level="3"> In enumerations, with a foll. <hi rend="ital">deinde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar primum suo, deinde omnium e conspectu remotis equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... deinde ... deinde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:58:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 58, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... deinde ... tum ... postremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... deinde ... praeterea ... postremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 56, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... tum ... deinde ... post ... tum ... deinde ....,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 14, 31</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... secundo loco ... deinde ... tum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:27:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 27, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:9" default="NO">8, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... subinde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... mox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38340.11" n="2" level="3"> Without other adverbs. </sense><sense id="n38340.12" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerenda pecunia primum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te Quicumque primum Produxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38340.13" n="(b)" level="5"> Strengthened with <hi rend="ital">omnium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first of all</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum omnium ego ipse vigilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38340.14" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simulac</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38340.15" n="(a)" level="5"> Ut primum, ubi primum, simul ac primum, cum primum, <hi rend="ital">as soon as ever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut primum potestas data est augendae dignitatis tuae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum potuit, istum reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ac primum niti possunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum affuerat, cum primum dati sunt judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:23:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38340.16" n="(b)" level="5"> Nunc primum, <hi rend="ital">now first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now for the first time</hi> (cf.: nunc demum, <hi rend="ital">now at last</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">post illa nunc primum audio, Quid illo sit factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38340.17" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dum</hi> (also by Plaut. joined in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pri-mumdum</orth>), <hi rend="ital">in the first place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">primum dum, si falso insimulas, etc. Iterum si id verum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium primumdum haed aedes jam face occlusae sicut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum dum omnium male dictitatur tibi vulgo in sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38340.18" n="(d)" level="5"> With <pos>adv.</pos> or <hi rend="ital">other expression of time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the first time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodie primum ire in ganeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo die primum convocati su mus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n38340.19" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">es pecially</hi>: fabula prime proba, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 188</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 603</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n38340.20" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīmĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">at first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first of all</hi> (ante- and post-class.): eripis primiter dapes, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 154, 26</bibl>; Inscr. (of the beginning of the third century of Christ) Lab. Epigr. Lat. Scop. in Egitto.</sense></entryFree>
princeps: <entryFree id="n38341" type="main" key="princeps1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">princeps</orth>, <itype>cĭpis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> and <sense id="n38341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst. comm.</hi> [primus-capio], <hi rend="ital">first</hi> in time or order (syn. primus).—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque in fugā postremus, ita periculo princeps erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps in proelium ibat, ultimus conserto proelio excedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps Horatius ibat,</quote> <trans><tr>first</tr>, <tr>in front</tr>, <tr>in advance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad <pb n="1445" /> <cb n="PRIN" /> loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps fuit ad conatum exercitus comparandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Firmani principes pecuniae pollicendae fuerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>were the first to promise</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps in agendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium nationum exterarum princeps Sicilia se ad amicitiam populi Romani applicuit,</quote> <trans><tr>was the first that entered into friendship with the Roman people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps et solus bellum his indixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps in haec verba jurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut principes talem nuntium attulisse viderentur,</quote> <trans><tr>to be the first</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Formiarum moenia dicitur Princeps tenuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matri Qui dederit princeps oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:714" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 714</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps turmas inducit Asilas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 620</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps ante omnes,</quote> <trans><tr>first of all</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 833</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam exordium princeps omnium esse debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualitatum aliae sunt principes, aliae ex lis ortae,</quote> <trans><tr>original</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis Romani anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addere principi Limo particulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies imperii princeps, vitae supremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38341.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the most eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">noble</hi> (syn. primores): <cit><quote lang="la">longe omnium gravitate princeps Plato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 19, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eudoxus in astrologiā facile princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 42, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam principes feminae,</quote> <trans><tr>certain noble ladies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principe loco genitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 40</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">principibus placuisse viris non ultima laus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 35</bibl></cit>. —Rarely of things: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma princeps Sardonychus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 138</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38341.2" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">princeps</orth>, <itype>cĭpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the first man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps senatŭs,</quote> <trans><tr>the first senator on the censor's list</tr>, <tr>the first member of the Senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38341.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most distinguished</hi> person: <cit><quote lang="la">quales in re publicā principes essent, talis reliquos solere esse civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutis,</quote> <trans><tr>one of the noblest of the Roman knights</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: trecenti conjuravimus principes juventutis Romanae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">high-born</hi> or <hi rend="ital">patrician youths</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 15</bibl> (= proceres juventutis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 28, 7</bibl>); 42, 61, 5.—In the time of the emperors this was also <hi rend="ital">a title of honor</hi> given to the prince, <hi rend="ital">the heir to the empire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotum,</quote> <trans><tr>the high-priest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 4, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38341.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contriver</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps atque architectus sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 22, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zeno eorum (Stoicorum) princeps non tam rerum inventor fuit, quam verborum novorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps Argonautarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Jason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes consilii publici, i. e. senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum omnium hic dux est atque princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:26:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 26, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regendae civitatis dux et sententiae princeps in senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pueri) aequalium principes,</quote> <trans><tr>first among their playfellows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of players</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes sententiarum consulares,</quote> <trans><tr>who were first asked for their opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus consilii principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli inferendi,</quote> <trans><tr>first in commencing hostilities</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam princeps equitum,</quote> <trans><tr>at the head of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:32" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 32</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">ancestors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc Dardanus ortus Iasiusque pater, genus a quo principe nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 168</bibl></cit> (cf., in this sense, principium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:748" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 748</bibl>; v. principium, II. B. 2.).—</sense><sense id="n38341.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">principes, qui utrique rei praeponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38341.6" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A prince</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sovereign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emperor</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">hic ames dici pater atque princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:123" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae non faciet quod principis uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:617" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 617</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:224" default="NO">8, 224</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38341.7" n="F" level="1"> In milit. lang.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">princĭpes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the second line of soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the</hi> hastati <hi rend="ital">and</hi> triarii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 8</bibl>; 37, 39; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:129" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 129</bibl>; and Becker, Antiq. 3, 2, p. 249 sq.; p. 269 sq.—Princeps also signifies, </sense><sense id="n38341.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A company</hi> or <hi rend="ital">division of the</hi> principes: signum primi principis, <hi rend="ital">of the first company of the</hi> principes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">octavum principem duxit,</quote> <trans><tr>was centurion of the eighth maniple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> ad Brut. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38341.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A centurion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">captain of the</hi> principes: princeps prior, <hi rend="ital">the first captain of the</hi> principes,<cb n="PRIN" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps tertiae legionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38341.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The office of centurion of the</hi> principes, <hi rend="ital">the centurionship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">captaincy of the</hi> principes: mihi primus princeps prioris centuriae est adsignatus, <hi rend="ital">the first captaincy of the</hi> principes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 34, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium priorum principum principiorem, si dici fas est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38342" type="main" key="Princeps2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Princeps</orth>, <itype>cĭpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated flute-player</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
principalis: <entryFree id="n38343" type="main" key="princi^pa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">princĭpālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>princeps</etym>. <sense id="n38343.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi>, <hi rend="ital">primitive</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est igitur tropus sermo a naturali et principali significatione translatus ad aliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:15:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38343.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38343.2" n="A" level="2"> In rank, <hi rend="ital">first</hi> in rank, station, or esteem, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 363, 38</bibl></cit>.—Of things abstr. and concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">pici principales in auguriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 18, 20, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principalia in Arabiā tus, et myrrha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 13, 30, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principalia aquatilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 38, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarum aliae sunt perfectae et principales, aliae adjuvantes et proximae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:18:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post haec duo principalia subjungebat illa non minus intuenda,</quote> <trans><tr>after these two principal points</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principali studio (i. e. praecipuo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principalia verba,</quote> <trans><tr>primitive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:15:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de culturā agri praecipere, principale fuit et apud exteros,</quote> <trans><tr>a principal thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 5, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principalis obligatio, res (opp. accessio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:126" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 126</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">principalior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl></cit>: principaliora quaeque, id. cont. Marc. 4, 36.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">princĭpālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n38343.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The foremost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overseer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintendent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiorum, i. e. of attendants,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 51, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38343.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The chief magistrate of a municipality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:1" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principalis aut decurio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 31, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 34, 2, § 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38343.5" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An inferior officer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38343.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a prince</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">princely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the emperor's</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">principalis quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 124, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:79" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatus arrogantiae principalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scortum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 22</bibl></cit>: vox, Just. Inst. prooem. 3.—</sense><sense id="n38343.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> principes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to the second line in the order of battle</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 12, 1, 151; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 15, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38343.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> principium <hi rend="ital">in a camp</hi>: principalis castrorum porta nominatur, quod in eo loco est, in quo principes ordines tendunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=224" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 224</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">manipulos legionum principali viā inducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta principalis dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 27</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">princĭpālĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n38343.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">chiefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principally</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plurimae bestiae, sed principaliter leones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38343.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">like a prince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperially</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">gaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores juventutis quam principaliter formas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:47" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutae leges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: non principaliter, <hi rend="ital">incidentally</hi>, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 12, 7, 5.</sense></entryFree>
principalitas: <entryFree id="n38344" type="main" key="princi^pa_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">princĭpālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>principalis</etym>, <sense id="n38344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superiority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pre-eminence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi> (post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. posteritas, the last place),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genera principalitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
principaliter: <entryFree id="n38345" type="main" key="princi^pa_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">princĭpālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. principalis <sense id="n38345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
principatus: <entryFree id="n38346" type="main" key="princi^pa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">princĭpātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>princeps</etym>, <sense id="n38346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pre-eminence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preference</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38346.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: omnem naturam necesse est .. habere aliquem in se principatum, ut in homine mentem ... in arborum autem radicibus inesse principatus putatur. Principatum autem id dico, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">h(gemoniko/n</foreign> vocant, quo nihil in quoque genere nec potest, nec debet esse praestantius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:11:29 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 11, 29 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque aetate antecedit, ita sententiae principatum tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia hujus belli sustinendi principatum tenet, i. e. in bello sustinendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae dignitatis principatum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tibi detulerat ex latronibus suis principatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: sol astrorum obtinet principatum, id. <cb n="PRIN" /> N. D. 2, 19, 49: <cit><quote lang="la">principatum in oleo obtinuit Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 2, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:156" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 36, 64, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:198" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 13, 76, § 198</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38346.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38346.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The chief place</hi> in the state or the army, <hi rend="ital">the post of commander-in-chief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassio dominatum et principatum dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cingetorigi principatus atque imperium est traditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtinere principatum totius Galliae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se dejectos principatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de principatu contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38346.4" n="2" level="3"> Of the empire (post-Aug.), <hi rend="ital">reign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sovereignty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nero toto principatu suo hostis generis humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 8, 6, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fenestella, qui obiit novissimo Tiberii Caesaris principatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 11, 52, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nerva res olim dissociabiles miscuit, principatum et libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:36:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 36, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38346.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origin</hi> (class. but very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">an mundus ab aliquo temporis principatu ortus est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">totius opusculi principatus,</quote> <trans><tr>the beginning</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 375</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n38346.6" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The hosts of angels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bad</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 8, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Col. 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
principialis: <entryFree id="n38347" type="main" key="princi^pi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">princĭpĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>principium</etym>, <sense id="n38347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is from the beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 423</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
principio: <entryFree id="n38348" type="main" key="princi^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">princĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to begin to speak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc genus principiandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Prin. Rhet. p. 328" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Prin. Rhet. p. 328</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
principium: <entryFree id="n38349" type="main" key="princi^pi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">princĭpĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>princeps</etym>, <sense id="n38349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origin</hi> (class.; syn.: primordia, initium). </sense><sense id="n38349.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">origo principii nulla est: nam ex principio oriuntur omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est cujus principium aliquod sit, nihil sit extremum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec principium, nec finem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus criminis neque principium invenire, neque evolvere exitum possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic fons, hoc principium est movendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:25:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 25, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum atque imperiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principium pontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principio lucis,</quote> <trans><tr>at daybreak</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in principiis dicendi,</quote> <trans><tr>at the commencement of a speech</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 121</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of a declaration in a lawsuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:245" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suave quoddam principium dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: principia ducere ab aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to derive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deduce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum magnarum principia a dis immortalibus ducuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principium urbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribendi recte sapere est et principium et fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne principium huc refer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Jove principium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a sanguine Teucri Ducere principium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capessere,</quote> <trans><tr>to begin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 49</bibl></cit>.—Adverb.: principio, a principio, in principio, <hi rend="ital">at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at first</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">principio ... postea, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 35, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principio generi animantium omni est a naturā tributum, ut se tueatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 5, 21</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">a principio: ac vellem a principio te audissem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixeram a principio, de re publicā ut sileremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 42, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in principio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principio ut,</quote> <trans><tr>as soon as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 40</bibl></cit>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.— Rarely of <hi rend="ital">the boundaries</hi> of a country or people: <cit><quote lang="la">adusque principia Carmanorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38349.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38349.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beginnings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elements</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bene provisa et diligenter explorata principia ponantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 12, 52</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: principia naturalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principia rerum, ex quibus omnia constant,</quote> <trans><tr>first principles</tr>, <tr>elements</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 117</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: obsta principiis (cf. the French: ce n'est que le premier pas qui coute),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38349.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That makes a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that votes first</hi>: tribus principium fuit, pro tribu Q. Fabius primus scivit, Lex Thoria, Rudorff. p. 142; Lex Appar. ap. Haubold, Moment. Leg. p. 85; Plebissc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 129" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Faucia curia fuit principium,</quote> <trans><tr>was the first to vote</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38349.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a beginner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancestor</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia principium moris fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Belus avorum Principium,</quote> <trans><tr>ancestor</tr>, <tr>progenitor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:748" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 748</bibl></cit>.—Here, too, prob. belongs PRINCIPIA SACRA, <hi rend="ital">Æneas and</hi> <pb n="1446" /> <cb n="PRIO" /> <hi rend="ital">his successors in Lavinium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancestors whom the Latins and Romans honored as deities</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2276</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38349.6" n="C" level="2"> In milit. lang.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">princĭpĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n38349.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The foremost ranks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the front line</hi> of soldiers, <hi rend="ital">the front</hi> or <hi rend="ital">van</hi> of an army: <cit><quote lang="la">post principia,</quote> <trans><tr>behind the front</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ero post principia, inde omnibus signum dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: post principia paulatim recedunt, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 135, 31</bibl>: deinde ipse paulatim procedere; <cit><quote lang="la">Marium post principia habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traversis principiis, in planum deducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 49, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites post principia collocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 43</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n38349.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The staff-officers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">members of the council of war</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mittere principia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:30" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a principiis salutari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Trig. Tyr. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advocatis legionum principiis et turmarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; Cod. 12, 47, 1.—</sense><sense id="n38349.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A large open space in a camp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which were the tents of the general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lieutenants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and tribunes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together with the standards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and where speeches were made and councils held; the general's quarters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura reddere in principiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in principiis ac praetorio in unum sermones confundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:6:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in principiis statuit tabernaculum, eoque omnes cotidie convenire (jussit), ut ibi de summis rebus consilia caperentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primores centurionum et paucos militum in principia vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:1:16" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 1, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38349.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Precedence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the first place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">principium ergo, columenque omnium rerum preti margaritae tenent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 106</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38349.11" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">selections</hi>, <hi rend="ital">selected passages</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">principiorum libri circumferuntur, quia existimatur pars aliqua etiam sine ceteris esse perfecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38349.12" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">mastery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi> (post-class.): <foreign lang="greek">a)rxh/</foreign>, magisterium, magistratus, praesidatus, principium, Gloss. Philox.: in Graeco principii vocabulum, quod est <foreign lang="greek">a)rxh/</foreign>, non tantum ordinativum, sed et potestativum capit principatum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
principor: <entryFree id="n38350" type="main" key="princi^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">princĭpor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n38350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [princeps], <hi rend="ital">to rule</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n38350.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">principari in nationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 14, 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolem ... principibus principantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">23, 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38350.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis in nostro corpore principatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Prophet. 6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Prophet. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prinus: <entryFree id="n38351" type="main" key="pri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pri=nos</foreign>, i. q. ilex, <sense id="n38351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the holmoak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">great scarlet oak</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:13:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 13, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prior: <entryFree id="n38352" type="main" key="pri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĭor</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prĭus</orth> (old form also in <sense id="n38352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> prior, Val. Antias and Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 767</bibl>), ōris, <hi rend="ital">adj. comp.</hi> [from obsol. <pos>prep.</pos> pri; v. primus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>], <hi rend="ital">former</hi>, <hi rend="ital">previous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prior</hi>, freq. to be translated <hi rend="ital">first;</hi> cf. superior; Cicero nearly always uses prior, opp. to posterior, in time; superior in sense of <hi rend="ital">former</hi>, in gen. relation to the present, when no other time is expressed; v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 921 sq. </sense><sense id="n38352.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita priori posterius, posteriori superius non jungitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me quaestorem in primis, aedilem priorem, praetorem primum populus Romanus faciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui prior has angustias occupaverit,</quote> <trans><tr>first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prior proelio lacessere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi utrique primas, priores tamen libenter deferunt Laelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 21, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priore loco causam dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>first</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priore aestate,</quote> <trans><tr>in the former summer</tr>, <tr>last summer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priore nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum est enim meā culpā, ut priore anno non succederetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prioribus comitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 22, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priore anno,</quote> <trans><tr>the year before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:56:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 56, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prioris anni consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius prior,</quote> <trans><tr>the elder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>of last year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 19, 24, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priore libro,</quote> <trans><tr>in the previous book</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <trans><tr>the forefeet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canities homini semper a priori parte capitis, tum deinde ab aversā,</quote> <trans><tr>the forepart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 47, § 131</bibl></cit>.—Pleon.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum prior Romanus exercitus praevenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius praecepta res erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 32, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 23, 2</bibl>.— Old <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> prior: hoc senatusconsultum prior factum est, Val. Antias ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 767</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">prior bellum, Quadrig. ib.: foedus prior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> (cf.: bellum Punicum posterior, Cass. Hem. ib.).—</sense><sense id="n38352.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Former</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">deceased</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">inter prieres fratres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38352.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prĭōres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <cb n="PRIS" /> <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">forefathers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancestors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ancients</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">abiturus illuc, quo priores abierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:18:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 18, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen dixere priores Ortygiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ingeniis investigata priorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">332</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">priores tradiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more priorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 218</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 52:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 52, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38352.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">better</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preferable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more excellent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">important</hi> (not in Cic. and Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">bellante prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:51" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C.
