S. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color puniceae flore prior rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nemo haberetur prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate et sapientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio et manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 96:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 96, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque prius, neque antiquius quidquam habuit, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 4</bibl></cit>.—Esp. with <hi rend="ital">potior</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potius quanto prius potiusque est Philippum nobis conjungere quam hos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:36:7:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 36, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla (res) prior potiorque visa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:8:29:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil prius nec potius visum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:39:47:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 39, 47, 4</bibl></cit>: unus Plinius est mihi priores, i. e. <hi rend="ital">worth more than they all</hi>, Sent. Augur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 27, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artium multitudine prior omnibus, eloquentiā nulli secundus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 346</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">adv. comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prĭus</orth>. </sense><sense id="n38352.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sooner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">previously</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38352.6" n="1" level="3"> Alone: <cit><quote lang="la">quem fuit aequius, ut prius introieram in vitam, sic prius exire de vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem prius Europā, post et Asiā, expellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 52, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vos prius experti estis, nunc Antiochus experitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 17, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">prius ... nunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius ... tum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:55:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 55, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius .... postea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 12, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38352.7" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, and often joined in one word, priusquam. </sense><sense id="n38352.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Before that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius quam lucet, assunt,</quote> <trans><tr>before dawn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius illi erimus quam tu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius quam plane aspexit ilico eum esse dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil prius mihi faciendum putavi, quam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui prius quam de ceteris rebus respondeo, de amicitiā pauca dicam,</quote> <trans><tr>before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego, prius quam loqui coepisti, sensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque prius fugere destiterunt, quam ad flumen Rhenum pervenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid potius faciam, prius quam me dormitum conferam, non reperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam aggrediar, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius quam ad portam venias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38352.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sooner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptii quamvis carnificinam prius subierint, quam ibin aut aspidem violent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 12, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1</bibl>.—Sometimes in an inverted order: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hoc genus hominum duravi, quam prius me ad plures penetravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14, 11</bibl> (3, 10, 10); v. Zumpt, Gram. § 576.—</sense><sense id="n38352.10" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">formerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in former times</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:51:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 51, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec prius fuere: nunc, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prioratus: <entryFree id="n38353" type="main" key="pri^o_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĭōrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prior</etym>, <sense id="n38353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">priority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preference</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
priorsum: <entryFree id="n38354" type="main" key="pri^orsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĭorsum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prĭorsus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>prisversus</etym>, <sense id="n38354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forwards</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus aut accedit priorsum, aut retrorsum recedit (al. prorsum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movetur corpus priorsus ac retrorsus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prisce: <entryFree id="n38355" type="main" key="prisce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">priscē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. priscus <sense id="n38355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
priscianus: <entryFree id="n38356" type="main" key="Prisci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Priscĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n38356.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated grammarian in the time of the emperor Justinian.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n38356.1" n="II" level="1"> Theodorus Priscianus, <hi rend="ital">a physician in the time of the emperors Gratian and Valentinian II.</hi></sense></entryFree>
priscus: <entryFree id="n38357" type="main" key="priscus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">priscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for prius-cus, like pris-tinus for prius-tinus, and magis for magius, a comparative form</etym>, <sense id="n38357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to former times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of many years ago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">olden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">primitive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">antique.</hi> Like the Greek <foreign lang="greek">a)rxai=os</foreign>, it denotes that which existed before our time, while pristinus is applied also to those things which have existed in our day (class.; cf.: vetus, antiquus). </sense><sense id="n38357.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">credendum est veteribus et priscis viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prisca illa et antiqua rei publicae forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 89, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud erat insitum priscis illis, quos cascos appellat Ennius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam Joves pluris in priscis Graecorum litteris invenimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 13, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et illud quod loquitur priscum visum iri putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priscae sanctimoniae virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: prisci Latini proprie appellati sunt ii, qui prius quam conderetur Roma, fuerunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> Müll.: priscae Latinae <cb n="PRIV" /> coloniae appellatae sunt, ut distinguerent a novis, quae postea a populo dabantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=241" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 241</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:197" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 197</bibl></cit>.— Priscus has the accessory idea of <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi>, and from the Augustan period is frequently applied to whatever dates from the earliest times, the golden age of Rome: <cit><quote lang="la">prisca gens mortalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priscus Inachus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prisco more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:282" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prisco ritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priscum illud acumen, Brute, tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:40:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 40, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prisci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the ancients</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum colerent prisci studiosius agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:779" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 779</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38357.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38357.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Former</hi>, <hi rend="ital">previous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quid si prisca redit Venus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 850</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38357.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Old-fashioned</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">strict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">prisci praecepta parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 159</bibl></cit>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Hor. C. 3, 21, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prisca supercilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cop. 34</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">priscē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the old-fashioned manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strictly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severely</hi> (class. but rare): <cit><quote lang="la">utrum me secum severe, et graviter, et prisce agere malit, an remisse, ac leniter, et urbane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38358" type="main" key="Priscus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Priscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the elder.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38358.1" n="I" level="1"> Of <hi rend="ital">the first Tarquin</hi>: Priscus Tarquinius est dictus, quia prius fuit quam Superbus Tarquinius, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38358.2" n="II" level="1"> Tarquinius Numicius Priscus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38358.3" n="III" level="1"> Helvidius Priscus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38358.4" n="IV" level="1"> Two Latin poets: <cit><quote lang="la">Priscus uterque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:10" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit> Burm. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
prisma: <entryFree id="n38359" type="greek" key="prisma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pri/sma</foreign>, <sense id="n38359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a geometrical figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the prism</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 722</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prista: <entryFree id="n38360" type="greek" key="prista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pri/sths</foreign>, <sense id="n38360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sawyer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pristinus: <entryFree id="n38361" type="main" key="pristi^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pristĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. priscus</etym>, <sense id="n38361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">former</hi>, <hi rend="ital">early</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi>, <hi rend="ital">primitive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pristine</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tua pristina dignitas et gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, b, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">labor meus pristinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra pristina bonitas et misericordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem consuetudinem fori et pristinum morem judiciorum requirere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio pristino incensa mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristinum animum erga populum Romanum conservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro pristina amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reminiscens pristini temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alc. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristina omnium confirmatur opinio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pristinum statum redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 54</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus super pristinum quattuor gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annotationes, Gell. praef.: pristina jura recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:129" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 129</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pristĭ-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a former condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pristinum restituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38361.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38361.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Just past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preceding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">previous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of yesterday</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei pristini perfidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnium pristinae noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38361.3" n="B" level="2"> = priscus, <hi rend="ital">old-fashioned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">former</hi>, <hi rend="ital">early</hi> (ante-class. and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in vobis resident mores pristini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. prol. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus pristinum nomen possident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> II. Cons. Stil. 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38362" type="main" key="pristi_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pristīnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pistrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pristis for pistrix</etym>, <sense id="n38362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> (the constellation of) <hi rend="ital">the Whale</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex occasu pristini sideris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pristis: <entryFree id="n38363" type="main" key="pristis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pristis</orth>, v. 1. pistris.</entryFree>
pristix: <entryFree id="n38364" type="main" key="pristix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pristix</orth>, <itype>icis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. pistris.</entryFree>
prius: <entryFree id="n38365" type="main" key="pri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prĭus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prĭusquam</orth>, v. <itype>prior</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos></entryFree>
privantia: <entryFree id="n38366" type="main" key="pri_vanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvantĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. privo, II. A.</entryFree>
privatarius: <entryFree id="n38367" type="gloss" key="pri_va_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvātārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>privatus</etym>, <sense id="n38367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">private</hi> (post-class.), Edict. Dioclet. p. 22.</sense></entryFree>
privaticius: <entryFree id="n38368" type="gloss" key="pri_va_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvātīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">privative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negative</hi>: privaticia, <foreign lang="greek">sterhtika/</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
privatim: <entryFree id="n38369" type="main" key="pri_va_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38369.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">apart from State affairs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as an individual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in private</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a private capacity</hi> (opp. publice; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): eloquentiā et privatim et publice homines perverse abutuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut privatim gerere aliquid malunt, aut capessunt rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatim mandare rem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in peregrino quaeritur, privatimne an publice venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41, 149</bibl></cit>: nec societatem tibi quippiam debere nec privatim<pb n="1447" /> <cb n="PRIV" />  Quintium debuisse, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatim degeneres, in publicum exitiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatim et publice rapere vasa caelata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publice privatimque gratiam petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem sanctam habuit tam privatim, quam publice,</quote> <trans><tr>towards individuals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:39" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. publicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui privatim plus possint quam ipsi magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla me ipsum privatim pepulit insignis injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius infestus privatim Papirio erat,</quote> <trans><tr>personally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38369.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38369.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particularly</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">de iis privatim condidit volumen Amometus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 20, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum cicinum privatim dicitur purgare praecordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 41, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatione privatim sibi assignatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38369.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">At home</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec privatim se tenuit, in foro inambulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
privatio: <entryFree id="n38370" type="main" key="pri_va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>privo</etym>, <sense id="n38370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privation</hi> of a thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit> and 38; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 9, 28: culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
privativus: <entryFree id="n38371" type="main" key="pri_va_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">denoting privation;</hi> in gram., <hi rend="ital">privative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negative</hi> (post-class. for privans): <cit><quote lang="la">ne particula privativa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: pars, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">kata\ ste/rhsin</foreign> dicunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 10</bibl>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">negatively</hi>, Boëth. Analyt. Prior. 1, p. 483.</sense></entryFree>
privato: <entryFree id="n38372" type="main" key="pri_va_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. privo, <sense id="n38372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
privatus: <entryFree id="n38373" type="main" key="pri_va_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from privo.</entryFree>
priveras: <entryFree id="n38374" type="gloss" key="pri_ve^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvĕras</orth>, <itype>mulieres privatas dicebant</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=252" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 252</bibl> Müll. [prob. from priver, era, erum, as a collat. form of privus].</entryFree>
privernum: <entryFree id="n38375" type="main" key="Pri_vernum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prīvernum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n38375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town of Latium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">ruins near Piperno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 540</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n38375.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prīvernas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Privernum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Privernian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 224</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 51, 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 16</bibl>. de senatu Privernate ita decretum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Privernati,</quote> <trans><tr>in the territory of Privernum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 51, 141</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prīvernātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Privernum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Privernatium causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina Privernatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 65</bibl></cit> Sill.</sense></entryFree>
privernus: <entryFree id="n38376" type="main" key="Pri_vernus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prīvernus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an Italian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 576</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
privicloes: <entryFree id="n38377" type="gloss" key="pri_vicloes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvicloes</orth>, <itype>privis id est singulis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=204" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 204</bibl> Müll. [archaic <case>dat.</case> or <sense id="n38377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> from priviclus, <lbl>dim.</lbl> from privus].</sense></entryFree>
privignus: <entryFree id="n38378" type="main" key="pri_vignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvignus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvigna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for privigenus, from privus - gigno; prop. of a separate race</etym>. <sense id="n38378.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A step-son; a step-daughter</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">uxor liberis ex aliā uxore natis noverca dicitur: matris vir ex alio viro natis vitricus appellatur: eorum uterque natos aliunde privignos privignasque vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 4</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n38378.1" n="A" level="2"> Privignus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 66, 188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:52" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">PRIVIGNVS MEVS, Monum. Ancyr.: venenum privigno datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38378.2" n="B" level="2"> Privigna: <cit><quote lang="la">de uxore Tuberonis et privignā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:6:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38378.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic matre carentibus Privignis mulier temperat innocens,</quote> <trans><tr>step-children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38378.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">privignae proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:161" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 161</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
privilegiarius: <entryFree id="n38379" type="main" key="pri_vi^le_gi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvĭlēgĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>privilegium</etym>, <sense id="n38379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has a privilege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a privileged person</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 5, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 14, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5:24" default="NO">42, 5, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
privilegium: <entryFree id="n38380" type="main" key="pri_vi^le_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvĭlēgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>privus-lex</etym>, <sense id="n38380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bill</hi> or <hi rend="ital">law in favor of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against an individual</hi> (class.): in privatos homines leges ferri noluerunt; <cit><quote lang="la">id est enim privilegium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 30, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de te privilegium tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 23, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">licuit tibi ferre non legem, sed nefarium privilegium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privilegia irrogare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim et crudelitatem privilegii publicis litteris consignavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 11, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38380.1" n="II" level="1"> In the post-Aug. period, <hi rend="ital">an ordinance in favor of an individual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privilege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prerogative</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium, jus praecipuum, immunitas): coloniam habuisse privilegium, et vetustissimum morem, arbitrio suo rempublicam administrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 47</bibl></cit> (56), 1; Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 109</bibl> (110): quaedam privilegia<cb n="PRIV" />  parentibus data sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">privilegio munitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:17:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privilegium aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 13, 15: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">athletarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
privo: <entryFree id="n38381" type="main" key="pri_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>privus</etym>. <sense id="n38381.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bereave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strip</hi> of any thing (class.; cf.: orbo, viduo). </sense><sense id="n38381.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec meretrix meum erum ... privavit bonis, luce, honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donis privatus sum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem approbatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepositio in privat verbum eā vi, quam haberet, si in praepositum non fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:11:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 29, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem communi luce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 23, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam aspectu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1038" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1038</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:695" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 695</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38381.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (anteclass.): me cum privares tui, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 498, 17</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 156 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n38381.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (ante-class.): quod res vis hunc privari pulcras quas uti solet? Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 500, 16</bibl> (l. l. p. 224 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n38381.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi> from any thing; with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominis superbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1091" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1091</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 77</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38381.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvantĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">privatives</hi>, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sterhtika/</foreign>: sunt enim alia contraria, quae privantia licet appellemus Latine, Graece appellantur <foreign lang="greek">sterhtika/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:11:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 11, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38381.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38381.7" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Apart from the State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiar to one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an individual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">private</hi> (opp. publicus or communis; cf. domesticus; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): nihil privati ac separati agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utatur privatis ut suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatus illis census erat brevis, Commune magnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem mutare privato consensu, opp. publico consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de communi quicquid poterat, ad se in privatam domum sevocabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res quae ipsius erant privatae,</quote> <trans><tr>private property</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatae feriae vocantur sacrorum propriorum, velut dies natales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n38381.8" n="B" level="2"> Esp., of persons, <hi rend="ital">not in public</hi> or <hi rend="ital">official life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">private</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprived of office</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum projectis fascibus et deposito imperio, privatus et captus ipse in alienam venisset potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 41</bibl>: vir privatus, <hi rend="ital">a private individual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who is not a magistrate</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in any public office</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">privato viro imperium extra ordinem dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bibulus ex iis, qui privati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatus an cum potestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privati, opp. reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 40, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38381.9" n="C" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia,</quote> <trans><tr>isolated</tr>, <tr>apart from the villages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita privata et quieta,</quote> <trans><tr>a private life</tr>, <tr>withdrawn from State affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38381.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi> in the phrases in privato, <hi rend="ital">in private</hi>, opp. in publico, <hi rend="ital">in public</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 18</bibl>: in privatum, <hi rend="ital">for private use</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernas vendidit in privatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 51</bibl></cit>: ex privato, <hi rend="ital">from one's private property</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributum ex privato conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 44</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38381.11" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. homo), <hi rend="ital">a man in private life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">citizen</hi> (opp. magistratus): <cit><quote lang="la">hic qualis imperator nunc privatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: an vero P. Scipio pontifex maximus Ti. Gracchum privatus interfecit; <cit><quote lang="la">Catilinam nos consules perferemus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium dedimus Sullae, privatus ut altum Dormiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38381.12" n="II" level="1"> In the time of the emperors, <hi rend="ital">private</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not imperial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not belonging to the emperor or to the imperial family</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id sibi (Domitiano) maxime formidolosum, privati hominis (i. e. Agricolae) nomen supra principis attolli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut summum fastigium privati hominis impleret, cum principis noluisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectacula,</quote> <trans><tr>not given by the emperor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvā-tō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">at home</hi> (very rare for the class. privatim, q. v.): privato nos tenuissemus, Liv. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1009</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
privus: <entryFree id="n38382" type="main" key="pri_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n38382.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Single</hi> (archaic): <cit><quote lang="la">veteres priva dixerunt, quae nos singula dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:20:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dies privos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 733</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privas mutari in horas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in privas quoniam (vox) se dividit aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 566</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38382.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38382.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every individual</hi>: privam quamque particulam <cb n="PRO" /> venti sentire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 261</bibl>.—Distributively, <hi rend="ital">one each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">item his discipulis privos custodes dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: ut privos lapides silices privasque verbenas secum ferrent, <hi rend="ital">each a stone</hi>, Senatus Consultum ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 43, 9</bibl>: abdomina thynni, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 35, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praesentia bubus privis binisque tunicis donati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf.: privos privasque antiqui dicebant pro singulis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38382.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One's own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">private</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(viden' ut pauper) conducto navigio aeque Nauseat, ac locuples, quem ducit priva triremis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turdus, Sive aliud privum dabitur tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opercula doliis priva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">privum aliquid da, quod possim titulis, incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:68" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci ea dicunt privis vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38382.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Deprived of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">privus ipse militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 100</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">turba imperitorum priva verae rationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 3, p. 43, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pro: <entryFree id="n38383" type="main" key="pro_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō</orth> (archaic collat. form, posi in posimerium; cf. pono, from posino; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">poti/</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">pot</foreign> with <foreign lang="greek">pro/s</foreign>), <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>root in Sanscr. <pos>prep.</pos> pra-, before, as in prathamas, first; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pro/</foreign>; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">pro/teros, prw=tos</foreign>, etc.; Lat.: prae, prior, priscus, etc.; perh. old <case>abl.</case> form, of which prae is the <hi rend="ital">loc.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n38383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in front of;</hi> and, transf., <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, with the idea of protection, substitution, or proportion. </sense><sense id="n38383.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, found only in the transf. comp. signif. (v. infra, II. B. 3.) in connection with <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: pro quam and pro ut (the latter usually written in one word, prout), like prae quam and prae ut. * </sense><sense id="n38383.2" n="A" level="2"> Pro quam, <hi rend="ital">in proportion as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec satis est, pro quam largos exaestuat aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1137</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38383.3" n="B" level="2"> Pro ut or <orth extent="full" lang="la">prout</orth>, <hi rend="ital">according as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accordingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proportionably as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">compararat argenti bene facti, prout Thermitani hominis facultates ferebant, satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuas litteras, prout res postulat, exspecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, prout cujusque ingenium erat, interpretabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prout locus iniquus aequusve his aut illis, prout animus pugnantium est, prout numerus, varia pugnae fortuna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With a corresp. <hi rend="ital">ita</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusque rationem ita haberi, prout haberi lege liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prout sedes ipsa est, ita varia genera morborum sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prout nives satiaverint, ita Nilum increscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38383.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>abl.</case> (late Lat. with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">PRO SALVTEM SVAM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">46, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2360</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in front of.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38383.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">sedens pro aede Castoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia, quae pro templis cernitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii qui pro portis castrorum in statione erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro castris copias habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro castris dimicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro oppido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro opere consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra pro moenibus locata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro castris explicare aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 37, 37, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:19:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 19, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">verbs of motion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar pro castris suas copias produxit,</quote> <trans><tr>before the camp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasce tabulas hic ibidem pro pedibus tuis obicito,</quote> <trans><tr>before your feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 337, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 4, p. 155, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38383.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., with the accessory idea of presence on the front part, on the edge or brink of a place, <hi rend="ital">on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the front of</hi>, often to be translated by a simple <hi rend="ital">on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro censu classis iuniorum, Serv. Tullius cum dixit, accipi debet in censu, ut ait M. Varro, sicuti pro aede Castoris, pro tribunali, pro testimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=246" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 246</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: pro significat in, ut pro rostris, pro aede, pro tribunali, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=228" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 228</bibl> Müll.; and: <cit><quote lang="la">pro sententia ac si dicatur in sententiā, ut pro rostris id est in rostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 226</bibl></cit> Müll.: hac re pro suggestu pronunciata, qs. <hi rend="ital">standing on the front part of the tribune</hi>, or, as we would say, <hi rend="ital">on the tribune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 3</bibl>: pro tribunali cum aliquid ageretur, <hi rend="ital">was transacted before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at my tribunal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 21</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pro tribunali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 15, 34</bibl>: pro contione, <hi rend="ital">before the assembled army;</hi> and, in gen., <hi rend="ital">before the assembly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatus pro contione Jugurtha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro contione laudibus legati militumque tollere animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortes viros pro contione donantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro contione litteras recitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 10, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro contione palam utrumque temptavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 11, 3</bibl>: <pb n="1448" /> <cb n="PRO" /> 4, 5, 11; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro comitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti pro consilio imperatum erat,</quote> <trans><tr>in the council</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicatio in triduum pro collegio decemvirūm imperata fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontifices pro collegio decrevisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro collegio pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suas simultates pro magistratu exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro munimentis castelli manipulos explicat,</quote> <trans><tr>before</tr>, <tr>on the fortifications</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 33</bibl>: stabat pro litore diversa acies, <hi rend="ital">in front of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon the shore</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem pro ripā componere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velamenta et infulas pro muris ostentant,</quote> <trans><tr>in front of</tr>, <tr>from the walls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pro muris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hoc mulieres puerique pro tectis aedificiorum saxa et alia, quae locus praebebat, certatim mittere,</quote> <trans><tr>standing on the edge of the roofs</tr>, <tr>from the roofs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 67:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 67, 1</bibl></cit> Kritz.—</sense><sense id="n38383.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38383.8" n="1" level="3"> To signify a standing before or in front of, for defence or protection; hence an acting <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in behalf of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in favor of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the benefit of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the side of</hi> (opp. contra, adversum): <cit><quote lang="la">veri inveniendi causā contra omnia dici oportere et pro omnibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc non modo non pro me, sed contra me est potius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim nihil contra Habitum valere, partim etiam pro hoc esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:32:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 32, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficillimum videtur quod dixi, pro ipsis esse quibus eveniunt ista, quae horremus ac tremimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum contra legem proque lege dicta essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 8</bibl></cit>: pro Romano populo armis certare, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 215 Vahl.); cf.: pro vostrā vitā morti occumbant, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 62</bibl> (Trag. v. 176 Vahl.): quae ego pro re publica fecissem, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=149" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ab eo praetermissum est, quod aut pro re publicā conquerendum fuit, aut pro eā disputandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia me semper pro amicorum periculis, nihil umquam pro me ipso deprecatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:49:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 49, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenit dimicare pro legibus, pro libertate, pro patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce et decorum est pro patriā mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro sollicitis non tacitus reis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spondere levi pro paupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes, quae viris aut loco pro hostibus et advorsum se opportunissumae erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 88, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliud adversus validissimas gentes pro nobis utilius, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et locus pro vobis et nox erit, Liv 9, 24, 8: et loca sua et genus pugnae pro hoste fuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 39, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro Corbulone aetas, patrius mos ... erant: contra, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38383.9" n="2" level="3"> With the notion of replacement or substitution, <hi rend="ital">in the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instead of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38383.10" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: numquam ego argentum pro vino congiario ... disdidi, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=149" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ibo pro te, si tibi non libet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego pro te molam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutata (ea dico), in quibus pro verbo proprio subicitur aliud ... ut cum minutum dicimus animum pro parvo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:92 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 92 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libenter etiam copulando verba jungebant, ut sodes pro si audes, sis pro si vis ... ain' pro aisne, nequire pro non quire, malle pro magis velle, nolle pro non velle. Dein etiam saepe et exin pro deinde et exinde dicimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro vitulā statuis dulcem Aulide natam, Hor S. 2, 3, 199: pro bene sano Ac non incauto fictum astutumque vocamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro ope ferendā sociis pergit ipse ire, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 28, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; Zumpt, Gram. § 667; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro eo, ut ipsi ex alieno agro raperent, suas terras, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38383.11" n="b" level="4"> Esp. freq. in connection with the title of any officer, to denote his substitute' pro consule, pro praetore, pro quaestore, pro magistro, etc. (afterwards joined into one word, as proconsul, propraetor, proquaestor, promagister, etc.), <hi rend="ital">proconsul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proprœtor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proquœstor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vice-director</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pro consule in Ciliciam proficiscens Athenas venissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:18:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 18, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum L. Philippus pro consulibus eum se mittere dixit, non pro consule,</quote> <trans><tr>instead of the consuls</tr>, <tr>not as proconsul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pro praetore, Caesarem (vocat),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 10, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 1</bibl>. cum Alexandriae pro quaestore essem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 11</bibl>' cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris Q. Caepionis Bruti pro consule ... Q. Hortensii pro consule opera, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: P. Terentius operas in portu et scripturā Asiae pro magistro dedit, id. <cb n="PRO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:11:10:1" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 11, 10, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Verr. 2:2:70:section=169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Fam. 13:65:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 65, 1</bibl>; see also the words proconsul, promagister, propraetor, proquaestor, etc.—</sense><sense id="n38383.12" n="c" level="4"> So of price, penalty, etc., <hi rend="ital">in exchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in return for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres minas pro istis duobus dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro hujus peccatis ego supplicium sufferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidium ejus quod pactus esset, pro carmine daturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro vitā hominis nisi hominis vita reddatur, non posse deorum inmortalium numen placari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id pro immolatis in foro Tarquiniensium Romanis poenae hostibus redditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, pro paternis sceleribus, poenas date,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 925" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 925</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro crimine poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:621" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 621</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38383.13" n="3" level="3"> Pro is also frequently used to denote the viewing, judging, considering, representing of a thing as something, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the same as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro sano loqueris, quom me appellas nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese ducit pro adulescentulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc Eduxi a parvulo, habui, amavi pro meo,</quote> <trans><tr>as my own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato ille noster qui mihi unus est pro centum milibus,</quote> <trans><tr>whose voice I regard as equal to that of thousands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliam nobis non pro penariā cellā, sed pro aerario fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Sestio pro occiso relictus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 38, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pro damnato mortuoque esset,</quote> <trans><tr>as good as condemned and dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:15:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 15, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa ratio, quae sapientibus pro necessitate est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia pro solatiis accipiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuli pro hostibus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo incredibilis visa res, ut non pro vano modo, sed vix pro sano nuncius audiretur,</quote> <trans><tr>as a boaster</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 49</bibl></cit>: quoniam de adventu Caesaris pro certo habebamus, <hi rend="ital">to consider as certain</hi>, Mat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 15, 6</bibl> et saep.; v. certus.—</sense><sense id="n38383.14" n="4" level="3"> Esp. in certain phrases: pro eo, <hi rend="ital">for the same thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as just the same</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si a Caesare, quod speramus, impetrarimus, tuo beneficio nos id consecutos esse judicemus: sin minus, pro eo tantum id habeamus, cum a te data sit opera, ut impetraremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.—With the particles of comparison: <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ac</hi>), <hi rend="ital">ac si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just the same as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as though</hi>: pro eo ac debui, <hi rend="ital">just as was my duty</hi>, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro eo ac si concessum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:32:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 32, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro eo est atque si adhibitus non esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro eo erit quasi ne legatum quidem sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:38" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 30, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: pro eo quod, <hi rend="ital">for the reason that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because</hi>: <cit><quote
