lang="la">pro eo quod ejus nomen erat magnā apud omnes gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:18:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 18, 75</bibl></cit>: pro eo quod pluribus verbis vos quam volui fatigavi, veniam a vobis petitam velim, Liv 38, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n38383.15" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">On account of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the sake of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor pro patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus pro recuperandā re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:311" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 311</bibl></cit> dub. (B. and K. omit pro): <cit><quote lang="la">dedit pro corpore nummos, i. e. to rescue his person,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem amare pro ejus eximiā suavitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 1, 55, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro quibus meritis quanto opere dilectus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pro incolumitate principis vota susceperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro bono (= bene),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 22, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38383.16" n="6" level="3"> Pro is used in its most general sense in stating the relation between two objects or actions, <hi rend="ital">in proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in comparison with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conformably to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by virtue of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">meus pater nunc pro hujus verbis recte et sapienter facit,</quote> <trans><tr>according to his story</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu pro oratione nec vir nec mulier mihi's,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 71</bibl></cit>: pro viribus tacere ac fabulari, <hi rend="ital">according to one's ability</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 4</bibl> (Trag. v. 181 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">facere certum'st pro copiā ac sapientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere pro viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pro dignitate laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium atrocius quam pro numero pugnantium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 29</bibl></cit>: pro imperio, <hi rend="ital">by virtue of his office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia pro imperio palam interfici non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 51, 2</bibl></cit>; hence, <hi rend="ital">imperatively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dictatorially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summarily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec illum ipsum submovere pro imperio posse more majorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 56, 12</bibl></cit>' hem! satis pro imperio, quisquis es, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tuā prudentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in eam rationem pro suo quisque sensu ac dolore loqueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus aliquid opis fortasse ego pro meā, tu pro tuā, pro suā quisque parte ferre potuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: pro <cb n="PROA" /> virili parte, <hi rend="ital">according to one's ability</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 66, 138</bibl>; Liv. praef. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:11:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 11, 23</bibl>. —Esp. freq.: pro ratā parte and pro ratā, <hi rend="ital">in proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proportionably;</hi> v. ratus: <cit><quote lang="la">pro se quisque,</quote> <trans><tr>each according to his ability</tr>, <tr>each one for himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 552</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tempore et pro re,</quote> <trans><tr>according to time and circumstances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro facultatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—Pro eo, quantum, or ut, <hi rend="ital">in proportion to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eāque pro eo, quantum in quoque sit ponderis, esse aestimanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:21:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 21, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem pro eo, quanti te facio, quicquid feceris, approbabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: tamen pro eo ut temporis difficultas tulit, etc., L. Metell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:54:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 54, § 126</bibl>.!*? In composition the o is long in some words, in others short (through the influence of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pro</foreign>-): prōdeo, prŏfiteor; and even in words borrowed from the Greek, as prōlogus.—Its signification has reference either to place, before, forwards; or to protection, for; procedo, procurro, profanus; procuro, propugno, prosum, protego.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38384" type="main" key="pro_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōh</orth>), <pos>interj.</pos>, an exclamation of wonder or lamentation, <sense id="n38384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">O! Ah! Alas!</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38384.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proh! bonae frugi hominem te jam pridem esse arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: pro Juppiter! Enn. ap. Varr L. L. 7, § 12 Müll. (Trag. v 225 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 31</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro supreme Juppiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro Juppiter, Hominis stultitiam!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro di immortales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: pro, dii immortales: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro curia inversique mores!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:46:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 46, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38384.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Parenthet.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro, quanta potentia regni Est, Venus alma, tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 758</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mea, pro! nullo pondere verba cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum, pro! degeneramus a patribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38384.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: pro divom fidem! Enn. ap. Don. ad. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 25</bibl> (Sat. v. 30 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 28</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro deum atque hominum fidem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 48</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">instead of which, ellipt.: pro deum immortalium!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro deum atque hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro fidem deum! facinus foedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38384.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: pro malae tractationis! Tert. Poen. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proaedificatum: <entryFree id="n38385" type="gloss" key="pro^aedi^fi^ca_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏaedĭfĭcātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pro-aedifico</etym>, <sense id="n38385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a balcony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proaedificatum dicitur, quod ex privato loco processit in publicum solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
proagorus: <entryFree id="n38386" type="greek" key="pro^a_go^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏāgŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">proh/goros</foreign>, <sense id="n38386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a director</hi>, the highest magistrate in some towns of Sicily, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23, § 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 39, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proamita: <entryFree id="n38387" type="main" key="pro^a^mi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-ămĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n38387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a great-grandfather's sister</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 4, 11, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proapodosis: <entryFree id="n38388" type="greek" key="pro^a^po^do^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏăpŏdŏsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">proapo/dosis</foreign>, <sense id="n38388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figure of speech so called</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proapodosis redditio orationis, id est, cum nomen in postremā parte membri, aut eadem quaecumque pars orationis redditur, ex quā idem membrum coepit: ut si dicas: Publicas tibi calamitates imputare debet respublica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, 175</bibl></cit> Grot. (Kopp, § 533, prosapodosis); so Aquila Fig. Sentent. p. 24 Capper.</sense></entryFree>
proarche: <entryFree id="n38389" type="greek" key="pro^arche_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏarchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">proarxh/</foreign>, <sense id="n38389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Æons of the Valentinians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 7, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proauctor: <entryFree id="n38390" type="main" key="pro^auctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-auctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a remote ancestor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">generis sui proauctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proavia: <entryFree id="n38391" type="main" key="pro^a^vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-ăvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n38391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a grandfather's</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grandmother's mother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a great-grandmother</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proavitus: <entryFree id="n38392" type="main" key="pro^a^vi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏăvītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>proavus</etym>, <sense id="n38392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a great-grandfather</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to one's ancestors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancestral</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans><tr>inherited from his forefathers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:83" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 83</bibl></cit>' potentia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:254" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 254</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamina didicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:366" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proavunculus: <entryFree id="n38393" type="main" key="pro^a^vuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-ăvuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great-grandmother's brother</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proavus: <entryFree id="n38394" type="main" key="pro^a^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-ăvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n38394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> proavūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:807" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 807</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n38394.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A grandfather's</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grandmother's father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a great-grandfather</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pater, avus, proavus, abavus, atavus, tritavus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. id. Mil. <pb n="1449" /> <cb n="PROB" /> 2, 4, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">proavus et avus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38394.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">forefather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancestor</hi>: in censurā de proavo multum cogitato tuo, i. e. of <hi rend="ital">Appius Claudius Cœcus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:807" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 807</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">felices proavorum atavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:312" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 312</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proba: <entryFree id="n38395" type="main" key="pro^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>probo</etym>, <sense id="n38395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proof</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 25, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
probabilis: <entryFree id="n38396" type="main" key="pro^ba_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38396.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that may be assumed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">proved; likely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">credible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">probabile est id, quod fere fieri solet, aut quod in opinione positum est, aut quod habet in se ad haec quandam similitudinem, sive id falsum est, sive verum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:29:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 29, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae probabilia videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:26:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 26, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim in his rebus aliquid probabile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 63, 154</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam incredibile, quod non dicendo fiat probabile, id. Par. praef. 1: ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjectura et ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probabilis et prope vera disputatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67:section=173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38396.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">worthy of approval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acceptable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commendable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laudable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38396.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Licinius probabilis orator: jam vero etiam probatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:263" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 76, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce peracutā atque magnā, nec alia re ulla probabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 68, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discipulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jucundior et probabilior populo orator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 36, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38396.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things concr. and abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caec. 25, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves non minus probabiles animis, quam corporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua maxime probabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli et caeli qualitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 3:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa nec odore, nec specie probabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 6, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir ingenio sane probabili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:180" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 180</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-bābĭlĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n38396.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Probably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">credibly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">rem breviter exponere et probabiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:35:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 35, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:17:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 17, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:82:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 82, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa probabiliter argumentatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justius et probabilius accusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:46:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 46, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38396.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Laudably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:46:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eleganter et probabiliter hoc dictum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:16:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte et probabiliter dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:16:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 16, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">probabilius Lutatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:8:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
probabilitas: <entryFree id="n38397" type="main" key="pro^ba_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>probabilis</etym>, <sense id="n38397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">probability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">credibility</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">magna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 21, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque nostros animos probabilitate percussit, id dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
probabiliter: <entryFree id="n38398" type="main" key="pro^ba_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. probabilis <sense id="n38398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
probamentum: <entryFree id="n38399" type="main" key="pro^ba_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>probo</etym>, <sense id="n38399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proof</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 13, 6, 10.</sense></entryFree>
probata: <entryFree id="n38400" type="greek" key="pro^ba^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbăta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/bata</foreign>, <sense id="n38400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sheep</hi> (post-Aug. for oves), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
probaticus: <entryFree id="n38401" type="greek" key="pro^ba^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">probatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n38401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sheep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sheep</hi>- (eccl. Lat.): probatica porta Hierosolymis, <hi rend="ital">the sheep-gate</hi>, near which the sheep destined for sacrifice were washed in a pool, Hier. de situ et nomine loc. Hebr. ex Joann. 5, 2.</sense></entryFree>
probatio: <entryFree id="n38402" type="main" key="pro^ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>probo</etym>. <sense id="n38402.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A trying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proving; a trial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examination</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">athletarum probatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oesypi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 10, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">croci sinceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 21, 42, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae recusant limae probationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 13, 76, § 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum,</quote> <trans><tr>a review</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38402.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38402.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assent</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ob probationem pretium datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tale visum nullum esse ut perceptio consequatur, ut autem probatio, multa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the assent of belief</tr>, <tr>though not the direct evidence of the senses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38402.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demonstration</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">firma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cujus rei probationem immittit indices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <trans><tr>ocular demonstration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38402.4" n="C" level="2"> In partic., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">the third part of a discourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> confirmatio or fides orationis, <hi rend="ital">in which the orator enumerates his arguments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 1</bibl>. <cb n="PROB" /></sense></entryFree>
probation: <entryFree id="n38403" type="greek" key="pro^ba^ti^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbătĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">proba/tion</foreign>, <sense id="n38403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> arnoglossa, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
probativus: <entryFree id="n38404" type="main" key="pro^ba_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>probo</etym>, <sense id="n38404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probative</hi> (post-class.): quaestiones, Auct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 299" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 299</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
probator: <entryFree id="n38405" type="main" key="pro^ba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an approver</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid interest inter suasorem facti et probatorem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 29, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:106" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum improbator, bonorum probator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38405.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A trier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examiner</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 20, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
probatoria: <entryFree id="n38406" type="main" key="pro^ba_to_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbātōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. epistula) [id.], <sense id="n38406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a letter of recommendation</hi> (from the emperor), <hi rend="ital">a certificate of qualification</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">sacra probatoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 58, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emissa sacri scrinii probatoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 60, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 36, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
probatus: <entryFree id="n38407" type="main" key="pro^ba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from probo.</entryFree>
probe: <entryFree id="n38408" type="main" key="pro^be_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. probus <sense id="n38408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
probianus: <entryFree id="n38409" type="main" key="Pro^bi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏbĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Probus.</entryFree>
probitas: <entryFree id="n38410" type="main" key="pro^bi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. probus</etym>, <sense id="n38410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">goodness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uprightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honesty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probity; modesty</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus, probitas, integritas in candidato requiri solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">probitatis commendatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatae probitatis femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla probitatis sinceritatisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">probitas laudatur et alget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
probiter: <entryFree id="n38411" type="main" key="pro^bi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. probus <sense id="n38411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
probito: <entryFree id="n38412" type="hapax" key="pro_bi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-bīto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to move forward</hi>: gradum, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 154, 3</bibl>; v. Trag. Rel. p. 101 Rib.</sense></entryFree>
problema: <entryFree id="n38413" type="greek" key="proble_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">problēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype> (<sense id="n38413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> problematorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> problematis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 1</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/blhma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a question proposed for solution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a problem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enigma</hi>, <hi rend="ital">riddle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puzzle</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 4</bibl>: problemata <foreign lang="greek">filosofou/mena</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristotelis libri sunt, qui Problemata physica inscribuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles in septimo problematorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:30:11" default="NO">2, 30, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in problematis Aristotelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proponam vobis problema,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 14, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">problēmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">problhmatiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">problematic;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">problē-matĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">problems</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cases set forth as problems</hi> (the title of a medical work), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:3:46" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 3, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
probo: <entryFree id="n38414" type="main" key="pro^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. probus</etym>. <sense id="n38414.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">test</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judge of</hi> any thing in respect of its goodness, fitness, etc. (rare in class. Lat.; not in Cic. or Cæs.; in eccl. Lat. very freq.). </sense><sense id="n38414.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem neque a moribus neque a fortunā probabat, sed tantum a viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tus probatur candore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucronem cultri ad buccam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram amaram sive macram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 9, 46, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut probavi ipse,</quote> <trans><tr>have learned</tr>, <tr>proved by experience</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum per ignem probatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 1, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">juga boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 14, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38414.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuo ex ingenio mores alienos probas,</quote> <trans><tr>judge of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias utilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.— So, <hi rend="ital">to test</hi>, <hi rend="ital">try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi> the mind or heart: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi vos probate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 13, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Zach. 13, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:138:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 138, 1</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n38414.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To esteem as good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to be satisfied with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approve</hi> a thing (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">comprobare): quis est, qui non probet, qui non laudet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istam rationem laudo vehementer et probo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: Cato ea sentit, quae non probantur in vulgus, id. Par. prooem.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asia picem Idaeam maxime probat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 128</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">objectclause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar maxime probat coactis navibus mare transire et Pompeium sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38414.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (mil. t. t.), <hi rend="ital">to approve for military service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlist</hi>: quo (die) primum probati sunt, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 30, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38414.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To declare</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">well done</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to express approbation of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approve</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">laudant fabrum atque aedes probant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petentibus, ut ad opera probanda, anni et sex mensium tempus prorogaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausu probatae puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:164" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 164</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38414.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To approve</hi> a person, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="PROB" /> <hi rend="ital">recognize</hi> as fit or worthy: <cit><quote lang="la">ad unum Vercingetorigem probant imperatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā impudentiā est, eumne testem improbabit quem judicem probarit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38414.7" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To represent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">show</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to be good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to make acceptable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recommend;</hi> and: aliquid alicui, <hi rend="ital">to convince</hi> one of any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (libros), ut spero, tibi valde probabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium meum P. Servilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:38:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 38, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrum officium ac diligentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:22:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 22, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum suum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia facta dictaque mea sanctissimis moribus tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 3</bibl></cit> (20), 3.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus de meo celeri reditu non probabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: se alicui, <hi rend="ital">to make one's self acceptable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Epicurus) multis se probavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 25, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā in legatione (Ligarius) et civibus et sociis ita se probavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi egregie probata est oratio tua,</quote> <trans><tr>has pleased</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38414.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">credible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demonstrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 37, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his ego judicibus non probabo, C. Verrem contra leges pecunias cepisse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam paucis verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 21, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se memorem probare,</quote> <trans><tr>grateful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfacile factu esse illis probat, conata perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc difficile est probatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et patrio pater esse metu probor,</quote> <trans><tr>my paternal fear shows that I am your father</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut Thrasvmachi probat exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:204" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 204</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: malo praesens observantiā, indulgentiā, assiduitate memorem me tibi probare, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38414.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass off</hi> a person for another: <cit><quote lang="la">loquebantur suppositum in ejus locum, quem pro illo probare velles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:30:section=78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 30, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tu istis lacrumis te probare postulas, Non pluris refert quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 101</bibl></cit>.—So <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: forma et aetas ipsast, facile ut pro eunucho probes, <hi rend="ital">pass for</hi> one, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 84</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38414.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Tried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tested</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of approved goodness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi> (syn. spectatus). </sense><sense id="n38414.11" n="1" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterarum homines artium spectati et probati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:27:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 27, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeniosos et opulentos, et aetatis spatio probatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:19:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 19, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum probatissimi artifices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probatissima femina,</quote> <trans><tr>most excellent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38414.12" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probata experimento cultura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boleti probatissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 5, 11, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probatissima palma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 5, 52, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probatissima statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 53</bibl></cit>: probata et exspectata adulescentia, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 437, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moneta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 23, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38414.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nemo probatior primoribus patrum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probatissimus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
probole: <entryFree id="n38415" type="greek" key="pro^bo^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbŏlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">probolh/</foreign>, <sense id="n38415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">production</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proboscis: <entryFree id="n38416" type="greek" key="pro^boscis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏboscis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-moscis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 24, 14</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">-muscis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 30</bibl>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">proboski/s</foreign>, <sense id="n38416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proboscis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a snout.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38416.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 49, 11</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 84, 2.—</sense><sense id="n38416.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the trunk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proboscis of an elephant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proboscidem amputare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:88" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 24, § 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proboscide abscissā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
probrachys: <entryFree id="n38417" type="greek" key="probra^chy^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">probrăchys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">probraxu/s</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">pou/s</foreign>), <sense id="n38417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a metrical foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of one short and four long syllables</hi> (e. g. rĕdūndāvērūnt), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 478</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
probriperlecebrae: <entryFree id="n38418" type="main" key="probriperle^ce^brae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">probriperlĕcĕbrae</orth>, v. perlecebra.</entryFree>
probrose: <entryFree id="n38419" type="main" key="pro^bro_se"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbrōse</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. probrosus <sense id="n38419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
probrositas: <entryFree id="n38420" type="main" key="pro^bro_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbrōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>probrosus</etym>, <sense id="n38420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shamefulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignominy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamy</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. D. 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
probrosus: <entryFree id="n38421" type="main" key="pro^bro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>probrum</etym>, <sense id="n38421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shameful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignominious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamous</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38421.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā probrosus, et opertus infamiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidissimus, et probrosissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Mamert. Grat. Act. ad Jul. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38421.2" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o magna Carthago, probrosis Altior Italiae ruinis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <trans><tr>lampoons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <trans><tr>abusive discourses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probrosae mollitiei homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compellationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbrōsē</orth>,<pb n="1450" /> <cb n="PROB" />  <hi rend="ital">disgracefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamously</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">probrose leno illam prostituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:31" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
probrum: <entryFree id="n38422" type="main" key="pro^brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">profe/rein</foreign>, to reproach; and opprobrium</etym>, <sense id="n38422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shameful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disgraceful act</hi> (class.; syn.: dedecus, flagitium). </sense><sense id="n38422.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38422.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: qui, nisi probrum, omnia alia indelicta aestimant, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitium probrumque magnum expergefacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignaviae luxuriaeque probra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emergere ex paternis probris ac vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69:section=162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69, § 162</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38422.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">unchaste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">immodest conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lewdness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unchastity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adultery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alcumenam insontem probri Amphitruo accusat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitii probrique plena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probri insimulasti pudicissimam feminam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 695</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">probri suspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam habere cum summo probro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">probrum virginis Vestalis ut capite puniretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=241" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 241</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n38422.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the disgrace arising from an infamous act</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamy</hi>: ea tum compressa parit huic puerum, sibi probrum, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo id probro ducet Alcumenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego jam tua probra aperibo omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in probro esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Curium) censores senatu probri gratiā moverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita rustica, quam tu probro et crimini putas esse oportere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be reproachful</tr>, <tr>shameful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam divitiae honori esse coeperunt, paupertas probro haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probrum castis, labem integris, infamiam bonis inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut probrum objectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probrum atque dedecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras implere probris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luere sanguine probra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:567" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 567</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38422.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">abuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproachful language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">libel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae plenae omnium in me probrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem probris maledictisque vexare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in isto tuo maledicto probrum mihi nullum objectas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:29:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 29, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probra dicere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactare in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingerere probra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">increpare multis ac servilibus probris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probra jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probris lacessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 980" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 980</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probris omnibus contaminatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
probrus: <entryFree id="n38423" type="hapax" key="probrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">probrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>probrum</etym>, <sense id="n38423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignominious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia spurca atque probra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
probus: <entryFree id="n38424" type="main" key="pro^bus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. prabhus, prominent, strong, from pra (v. pro) and bhu = fio</etym>, <sense id="n38424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">able;</hi> esp. in a moral point of view, <hi rend="ital">upright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuous</hi>, etc. (class.). </sense><sense id="n38424.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">frugi et probum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probum patrem esse oportet, qui gnatum suom esse probiorem, quam ipsus fuerit, postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantores probos,</quote> <trans><tr>skilful</tr>, <tr>excellent</tr>, <tr>fine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">architectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquam rem,</quote> <trans><tr>fit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 67</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38424.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">well-behaved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-conducted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam cives vero rumificant probam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proba et modesta (mulier),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38424.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things abstr. and concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">affer huc duas clavas, sed probas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:170" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 51, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arbor. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arbor. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7</bibl></cit>?? color, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 2</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">proba merx facile emtorem reperit,</quote> <trans><tr>the best goods sell themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 129</bibl></cit>; cf.: probae fruges suāpte naturā enitent, Acc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upright</hi> man: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta peccat, cum probi orationem adfingit improbo stultove sapienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 22, 74</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n38424.4" n="A" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellently</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">milites armati atque animati probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes factae probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>?? probe lepideque concinnatus,<cb n="PROC" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque adhuc actum est probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probe curare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis scite et probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antipater, quem tu probe meministi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aquaeductu probe fecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus satis probe ornatus auxiliis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud probe judicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Servio probe dicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:41:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 41, 151</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 19, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38424.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capitally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bravely</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">plane, omnino, sine dubio): appotus probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percutere aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>, v. 162: <cit><quote lang="la">decipere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>, v. 268: <cit><quote lang="la">errare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, ut sit acutus culter probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui similis est probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdocta est probe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 120</bibl></cit>. —In responses, as a token of applause, <hi rend="ital">well done! good! bravo!</hi> unde agis te? <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Unde homo ebrius. <hi rend="ital">Philo.</hi> Probe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 4, 28</bibl>: miles concubinam intro abiit oratum suam, ab se ut abeat. <hi rend="ital">Acr</hi> Eu, probe! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">probissime,</quote> <trans><tr>very well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n38424.6" n="B" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏbĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capitally</hi> (ante-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 510, 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38425" type="main" key="Pro^bus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 24</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏbĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">named from</hi> a Probus: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proca: <entryFree id="n38426" type="main" key="Pro^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Procas.</entryFree>
procacia: <entryFree id="n38427" type="main" key="pro^ca_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>procax</etym>, <sense id="n38427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shamelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudence</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 22 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
procacitas: <entryFree id="n38428" type="main" key="pro^ca_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shamelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudence</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">itaque a petendo petulantia, a procando, id est poscendo, procacitas nominata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 6, 19</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 23, 19</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">procacitatem alicujus coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procacitatis et petulantiae certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:41:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 41, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galli gallinacei,</quote> <trans><tr>lechery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
