procaciter: <entryFree id="n38429" type="main" key="pro^ca_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. procax <sense id="n38429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
procalare: <entryFree id="n38430" type="gloss" key="proca^la_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">procălāre</orth>, provocare ex Graeco <foreign lang="greek">kalei=n</foreign>, id est voco, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=225" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 225</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
procapis: <entryFree id="n38431" type="gloss" key="pro^ca^pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcăpis</orth>, <itype>progenies, quae ab uno capite procedit</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=225" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 225</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
procas: <entryFree id="n38432" type="main" key="Pro^cas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏcas</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Alba</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Proca Numitorem atque Amulium procreat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; Ov M. 14, 622; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:F. 4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:143" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus ille Procas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 767</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procatio: <entryFree id="n38433" type="main" key="pro^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proco</etym>, <sense id="n38433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a demanding in marriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a suing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wooing</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 320, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procax: <entryFree id="n38434" type="main" key="pro^cax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wanton</hi> (class.; syn.: petulans, protervus). </sense><sense id="n38434.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">leno procax, rapax, trahax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procaciores estis vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum meretrix, sed etiam procax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procax in lacessendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procax ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 62</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procax otii, i. e. in otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 46</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38434.2" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">procaces manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 6, 7, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fescennina locutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequitiae procaciores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem procacibus scriptis diffamare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procacissima lixarum ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier meretrix et procax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 16, 30</bibl></cit>.—Of the vine: maritas populos complexae, atque per ramos earum procacibus brachiis scandentes, <hi rend="ital">with wanton arms</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">entwining tendrils</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 10</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stormy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 536</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">boldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wantonly</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">finem procaciter orto sermoni imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: procacius stipendium flagitare quam ex modestiā militari. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">procacissime patris tui memoriam illudunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:34" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum obfirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:21:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 21, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procedo: <entryFree id="n38435" type="main" key="pro_ce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi> (class.; cf.: progredior, prodeo). </sense><sense id="n38435.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38435.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">procedere ad forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc procede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: ante agmen,<cb n="PROC" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:27:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 27, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil cum procede re lintrem Sentimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus aequis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passu tacito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:351" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 351</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38435.4" n="1" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">march forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to advance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lente atque paulatim proceditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen procedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">processum in aciem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi jam pridem avidi certaminis procedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 62, 6</bibl></cit>.—Cf. of ships, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 587</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.5" n="2" level="3"> Of processions, <hi rend="ital">to go on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">funus interim Procedit: sequimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacito procedens agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:91" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidisti Latios consul procedere fasces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:443" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 443</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.6" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38435.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">issue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foribus foras procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra munitiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B. G 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:36:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 36, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e tabernaculo in solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pedes procedere nascentem, contra naturam est,</quote> <trans><tr>to be born feet first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 8, 6, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediā procedit ab aulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.8" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to show one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum veste purpureā procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 52, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam alicui procedere,</quote> <trans><tr>to go towards</tr>, <tr>go to meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 13, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurthae obvius procedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 53, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedat vel Numa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 138</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.9" n="c" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to issue from the mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be uttered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed interdum voces procedebant contumaces et inconsultae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 60 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 14, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.10" n="d" level="4"> Of stars, etc., <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come into view</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ecce Dionaei processit Caesaris astrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesper,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.11" n="e" level="4"> Of the moon, <hi rend="ital">to wax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.12" n="2" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow</hi> (ante-class. and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">antequam radices longius procedere possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque germen de cicatrice procedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma sine dubio processura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 3, 1</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n38435.13" n="3" level="3"> Of place, <hi rend="ital">to project</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut in pedes binos fossa procedat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydia super Ioniam procedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 29, 30, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promuntorium, quod contra Peloponnesum procedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38435.15" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elapse</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi plerumque noctis processit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pel. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque dies alterque dies processit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies procedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedente tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>in process of time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aetate processerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus processit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedente die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 20, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedunt tempora tarde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipient magni procedere menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars major anni jam processerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.16" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to present</hi> or <hi rend="ital">show one's self</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc volo subducto gravior procedere voltu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to conduct myself more gravely</tr>, <tr>to undertake more serious matters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit> (3, 1), 9: <cit><quote lang="la">quis postea ad summam Thucydidis, quis Hyperidis ad famam processit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.17" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">get on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make progress</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">proficio): dicendi laude multum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 36, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in philosophiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoribus longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:180" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 48, 180</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 23, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad virtutis aditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitio et procedendi libido,</quote> <trans><tr>a passion for getting on</tr>, <tr>for rising in the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Ep 8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicuum est, quo compositiones unguentorum processerint,</quote> <trans><tr>to what extent</tr>, <tr>how far</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ratione et viā procedat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo vecordiae processit, ut,</quote> <trans><tr>went so far in folly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adherbal, ubi intellegit eo processum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">processit in id furoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eoque ira processit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex infimā fortunā in ordinem senatorium, et ad summos honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.18" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To run on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et cum stationes procederent, prope obruentibus infirmum corpus armis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>guard duty returned so frequently as to seem continuous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut iis stipendia procederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 11, 14</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.19" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow;</hi> esp. of speech, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dissuadendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 117</bibl>: non imitor <foreign lang="greek">lakwnismo\n</foreign> tuum: <cit><quote lang="la">altera jam pagella procedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 25, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.20" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To</hi> <pb n="1451" /> <cb n="PROC" /> <hi rend="ital">turn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosper</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">parum procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam summis oratoribus non satis ex sententiā eventum dicendi procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:27:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 27, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui pulcherrime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 19, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia prospere procedent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> (cf. succedo): quibus cum parum procederet, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">velut processisset Spurio Licinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 44, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to turn out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">succeed well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane quod tu occoeperis negotium agere, id totum procedit diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferme ut quisque quidque occoeperit, sic ei procedunt post principia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syre, processisti hodie pulcre,</quote> <trans><tr>have succeeded finely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si processit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si consilia Andranodoro processissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.21" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To turn out favorably for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to result in favor of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to benefit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be of use to</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">totidem dies emptori procedent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benefacta mea reipublicae procedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.22" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be effectual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum non processerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicina processit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.23" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be counted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reckoned as</hi> any thing (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut binae (oves) pro singulis procedant,</quote> <trans><tr>shall be reckoned as one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 3, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ita procedit, si ea, cui donabatur, eum interposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.24" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numquid processit ad forum hodie novi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38435.25" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proceed from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be derived from</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">res, quae a sacratissimis imperatoribus procedunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 37, 3</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in processā aetate,</quote> <trans><tr>advanced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 100" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proceleusmaticus: <entryFree id="n38436" type="greek" key="pro^ce^leusma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcĕleusmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prokeleusmatiko\s</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">pou/s</foreign>), <sense id="n38436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a metrical foot of four short syllables;</hi> as, ănĭmŭlă, mĭsĕrŭlă, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 513</bibl> P.; cf. Mar. Victorin. p. 2546 P.</sense></entryFree>
procella: <entryFree id="n38437" type="main" key="pro^cella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n38437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [pro and root kel; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ke/lhs</foreign>, runner; cf.: celer, celox], <hi rend="ital">a violent wind</hi> (by which things are prostrated), <hi rend="ital">a storm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurricane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempest</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38437.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">procella distat latitudine a vortice et a turbine disjectā nube verius quam ruptā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 49, 50, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbinis inmanem vim provomit atque procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres, nimbi, procellae, turbines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">creber procellis Africus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridens Aquilone procella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mugiat Africis Malus procellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis quassata procellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raperent mea poma procellae, id. Nux, 163: procella nivem effuderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbrem excusserant procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thalle, turbidā rapacior procellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">validi venti collecta procella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 124</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38437.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38437.3" n="A" level="2"> (Mostly in <number>plur.</number>) <hi rend="ital">A storm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commotion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestates et procellas in illis fluctibus concionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 2, 5</bibl></cit> (also cited ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 48</bibl>, and particularly mentioned as a figure, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:48:section=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 48, § 7</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">vita tranquilla et quieta remota a procellis invidiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:56:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 56, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut procellam temporis devitaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:53:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 53, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitari tribuniciis procellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionum procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procellae civiles,</quote> <trans><tr>civil commotions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferimur procellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 594</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 656</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38437.4" n="B" level="2"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n38437.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sudden attack</hi> of cavalry: <cit><quote lang="la">hac velut procellā ita consternavit equos, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equestrem procellam excitemus oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38437.6" n="2" level="3"> In gen., of <hi rend="ital">a fierce battle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic secunda belli Punici procella desaevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 203</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38437.7" n="3" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">a storm</hi> of eloquence: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam illam eloquentiae procellam effunderet (Ulixes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:158" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procello: <entryFree id="n38438" type="main" key="pro_cello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-cello</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf.: percello, procella, celer</etym>, <sense id="n38438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast down</hi> (anteclass.): procello, <foreign lang="greek">peritre/pw</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: procellunt sese in mensam, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lie down</hi> (at table), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 167</bibl> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: procellunt, procumbunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=225" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 225</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
procellose: <entryFree id="n38439" type="main" key="pro^cello_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcellōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. procellosus <sense id="n38439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
procellosus: <entryFree id="n38440" type="main" key="pro^cello_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcellōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>procella</etym>, <sense id="n38440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of storms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stormy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempestuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boisterous</hi> (perh. not ante - Aug.): ver procellosum,<cb n="PROC" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">status caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:621" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 621</bibl></cit>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: procellosissimum pelagus, Aug. Civ. Dei, 5, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: Noti, <hi rend="ital">stormy winds</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">which raise storms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 6, 44</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcellōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">boisterously</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">genus humanum procellose tumidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 13:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 13, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procer: <entryFree id="n38441" type="main" key="pro^cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcer</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, in <number>sing.</number> only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 26</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 2</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcĕres</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (anteclass. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, in the <sense id="n38441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procum patricium in descriptione classium quam facit, Serv. Tullius, significat procerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=249" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 249</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam (ut censoriae tabulae loquuntur) fabrum et procum audeo dicere, non fabrorum et procorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 156</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pro and root kar- of creo; cf. procērus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n38441.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble;</hi> plur., <hi rend="ital">the leading men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chiefs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nobles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">princes</hi> (class.; syn.: primores, optimates, primi): scindunt proceres Pergamum, <hi rend="ital">the Grecian chiefs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">princes</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiebam nostros proceres clamitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etruscorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego proceribus civitatis annumeror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caecina Largus e proceribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectos populi ad proceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in procerum coetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 261</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:213" default="NO">3, 213</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proceres rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:142" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 142</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">procerum seditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnosco procerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pueritiā fuit pastor nonnumquam et procer,</quote> <trans><tr>a leader</tr>, <tr>captain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38441.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the foremost</hi> or <hi rend="ital">most celebrated men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the masters</hi> in an art, science, etc. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">proceres artis ejus (medicinae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicatis in genere utroque (pingendi) proceribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procere: <entryFree id="n38442" type="main" key="pro_ce_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcērē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. procerus <sense id="n38442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proceres: <entryFree id="n38443" type="main" key="pro^ce^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcĕres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. procer.</entryFree>
proceritas: <entryFree id="n38444" type="main" key="pro_ce_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcērĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>procerus</etym>, <sense id="n38444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a high growth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tallness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38444.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">candor hujus te et proceritas, vultus oculique perpulerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>his tall stature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 11</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 1, 11</bibl>.—Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">cum admiraretur proceritates arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmetis est proceritas et decor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbarum,</quote> <trans><tr>height</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tiliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 14, 25, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balsami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollentis se proceritate luxuriosā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38444.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">length</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (animalia) altiora sunt, ut anseres, ut cygni, ut cameli, adjuvantur proceritate collorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alces, ni proceritas aurium et cervicis distinguet, jumento similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 15, 16, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pediculi (glandis) proceritas brevitasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 13, 21, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:212" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 212</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proceritudo: <entryFree id="n38445" type="main" key="pro_ce_ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcērĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">high stature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tallness</hi> (late Lat. for proceritas), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, 87</bibl>; Auct. Itin. Alex. M. 112 Mai; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 1:30" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 1, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procerulus: <entryFree id="n38446" type="main" key="pro_ce_ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcērŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n38446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">rather long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longish</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 351, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procerus: <entryFree id="n38447" type="main" key="pro_ce_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcērus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pro and root karof creo; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kra/tos, kratero/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n38447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38447.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">excelsus): procerum collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:313" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves cornibus proceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in procero corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo procerae staturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitu procerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueritia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo procerior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus est calceamentis altiusculis, ut procerior videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Galatea) floridior pratis, longa procerior alno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter hos procerissimos populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procerissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:717" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 13, 33</bibl></cit>.—Of plants, trees: <cit><quote lang="la">procerissimae populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim abiete procerius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proceras lauros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeianum (genus) procerius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 140</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38447.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., perh. <hi rend="ital">the name of a company of tall soldiers</hi>, similar to our <hi rend="ital">grenadiers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">VETERANVS EX PROCERIORIBVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 800, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38447.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">large</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">passus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 827</bibl></cit>: aves procero rostro, Cic. <cb n="PROC" /> N. D. 1, 36, 101: <cit><quote lang="la">lupi,</quote> <trans><tr>large</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">thoes, luporum id genus est, procerius longitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 34, 52, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procerior cauda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 43, 99, § 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proceriores uniones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucurbitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 72</bibl></cit>: syllabae procerae sunt, quae vocalem longam habent in paenultima, ut facultas, <hi rend="ital">long</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 423</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">anapaestus, procerior numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 185</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">plangebant aliae proceris tympana palmis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>outstretched</tr>, <tr>upraised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 289</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcērē</orth>; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchium procerius projectum,</quote> <trans><tr>stretched out to a greater length</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 220</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
processio: <entryFree id="n38448" type="main" key="pro_cessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>procedo</etym>, <sense id="n38448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marching onwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an advance;</hi> in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">a militibus nostris reditus magis maturus quam processio longior quaereretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; so in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the formal entrance of the consul upon his office,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the public appearance of the emperor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pertin. 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38448.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A religious procession</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
processus: <entryFree id="n38449" type="main" key="pro_cessus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from procedo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38450" type="main" key="pro_cessus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>procedo</etym>, <sense id="n38450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">process.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38450.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">processus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:65:232" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 65, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">processum vult,</quote> <trans><tr>the progress of the discourse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 62, 210</bibl></cit>: in Graecis litteris magnum processum habere, Attei. Philol. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin in processu coepit crudescere morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>in its course</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:29:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Nam. 1, 439</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantos processus efficiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:272" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 78, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic tua processus habeat fortuna perennes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversatio alienorum processuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 2:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimica semper alienis processibus invidia,</quote> <trans><tr>success</tr>, <tr>good fortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 9:4:section=28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 9, 4, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">queruntur et de consiliis et de processibus suis,</quote> <trans><tr>of their results</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 115, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in malis,</quote> <trans><tr>progress</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 20, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38450.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38450.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The ceremonious appearance of the consul on assuming office</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38450.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The public appearance of the emperor</hi> (opp. to recensus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Gall. 17, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38450.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">An attack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus turmarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38450.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38450.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A projection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">process</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38450.8" n="B" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">a passing away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elapsing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lapse</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ternis dierum ac noctium processibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 121</bibl></cit>: temporis, Firm. 3, 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 16, 6</bibl>; Cod. 31, 2, 3.</sense></entryFree>
procestria: <entryFree id="n38451" type="gloss" key="procestri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">procestrĭa</orth> <itype>dicuntur</itype>, quo proceditur in muro. Aelius procestria aedificia dixit esse extra portam, Artorius procestria, quae sunt ante castra, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=225:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 225, 12</bibl>.</entryFree>
prochos: <entryFree id="n38452" type="greek" key="pro^chos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏchos agrĭos</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/xos a)/grios</foreign>, <sense id="n38452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, perh. pure Lat. saxifraga, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prochyta: <entryFree id="n38453" type="main" key="Pro^chy^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏchyta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏchytē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*proxu/th</foreign>, <sense id="n38453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small Italian island near Campania</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Procida</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 88, 89, § 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 6, 12, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 715</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procidentia: <entryFree id="n38454" type="main" key="pro_ci^denti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcĭdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 1. procido <sense id="n38454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38455" type="main" key="pro_ci^denti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcĭdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. procido</etym>, <sense id="n38455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forwards</hi> of a part of the body out of its place, <hi rend="ital">a procidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolapse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 9, 81, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 8, 58, § 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <itype>procido</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n38455.1" n="II" level="1"> Gram. t. t. = <foreign lang="greek">a)nti/ptwsis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the substitution of one case for another</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1099</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
procido: <entryFree id="n38456" type="main" key="pro_ci^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-cĭdo</orth>, <itype>ĭdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cado</etym>, <sense id="n38456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall forwards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall flat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall prostrate</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n38456.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pedes alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps procidit ante proram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universi prociderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in corpus amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:47" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tu lassata sequendo Procidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsa cupressus Euro Procidit late,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri pars prociderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38456.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of a part of the body, <hi rend="ital">to fall down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forwards</hi> out of its place: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi procidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi procidentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 73, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si procidant vulvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 6, 54, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastilli ex acaciā sistunt vulvam et sedem procidentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 12, 67, § 110</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcĭdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">parts of the body that</hi> <pb n="1452" /> <cb n="PROC" /> <hi rend="ital">fall out of their place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 27, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:99" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 59, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38457" type="gloss" key="proci_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">procīdo</orth>, no <sense id="n38457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>īsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pro-caedo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to strike down</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">procisus, praecisus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
prociduus: <entryFree id="n38458" type="main" key="pro_ci^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcĭdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. procido</etym>. <sense id="n38458.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fallen down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostrate</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">salix procidua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 57, § 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:127" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 415</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38458.1" n="II" level="1"> Of parts of the body, <hi rend="ital">falling down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prociduous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 20, 87, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbilicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 20, 81, § 211</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procieo: <entryFree id="n38459" type="main" key="pro_ci^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-cĭĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n38459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>cĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to call forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi> (post-class.): matrem procitum plurimi venerunt, Liv. Andron. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=225" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 225</bibl> Müll. (a transl. of the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">to/ssoi mhte/r) e)mh\n mnw=ntai</foreign>, Od. 1, 248).—</sense><sense id="n38459.1" n="II" level="1"> Procitum testamentum dicebatur velut procatum, provocatum, id est irritum ac ruptum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=225" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 225</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
procilius: <entryFree id="n38460" type="main" key="Procili^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Procilĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n38460.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An historian contemporary with Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38460.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A quœstor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6</bibl> (8), 1.</sense></entryFree>
procilla: <entryFree id="n38461" type="main" key="Procilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Procilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or Julia Procilla, <sense id="n38461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mother of Agricola</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procinctualis: <entryFree id="n38462" type="main" key="pro_cinctu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcinctŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>procinctus</etym>. <sense id="n38462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the setting out of an army</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procinctus: <entryFree id="n38463" type="main" key="pro_cinctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from procingo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38464" type="main" key="pro_cinctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcinctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>procingo, prop. a girding up; hence, transf.</etym>, milit. t. t., <sense id="n38464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being prepared</hi> or <hi rend="ital">equipped for battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">readiness for action</hi>: procinctum, <foreign lang="greek">(/otan ei)s po/lemon sugkale/swntai</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem armatum semper ac velut in procinctu stantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque in procinctu et castris habitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in procinctu bellorum excubare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 66</bibl></cit>: testamentum facere in procinctu, <hi rend="ital">to make one's will on the battle-field</hi> (one of the three ways of making a will), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:101" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 10</bibl>.—Prov.: in procinctu habere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to have a thing ready</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitatem abditam, clementiam in procinctu habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi in procinctu paratamque ad omnes casus habuerit eloquentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38464.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a military enterprise</hi> (late Lat.): et Lentiensibus indictum est bellum; <cit><quote lang="la">ad quem procinctum imperator egressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 9, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38464.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an engagement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procinctu omisso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">27, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post procinctus ancipites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in procinctu versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:13:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procingo: <entryFree id="n38465" type="main" key="pro_cingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-cingo</orth>, no <sense id="n38465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>cinctus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to gird up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equip;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">prepared for battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready for action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in fighting order</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum procinctae classes erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: classis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an army ready to engage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an army</hi>, Lex ap. Fest. s. v. opima, p. 198, a Müll.; Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:10:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procitant: <entryFree id="n38466" type="gloss" key="proci^tant"><orth extent="full" lang="la">procĭtant</orth>, provocitant. Citare enim vocitare est: unde procet et procit et procat dicebant pro poscit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=225" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 225</bibl> Müll.: procitat, <foreign lang="greek">prokalei=tai</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
procitare: <entryFree id="n38467" type="gloss" key="procita_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">procitāre</orth>, <itype>saepe prolicere, id est producere</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> (perh. more correctly, prolicitare).</entryFree>
procitum: <entryFree id="n38468" type="gloss" key="pro_ci^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcĭtum</orth> <itype>testamentum</itype>, v. procieo.</entryFree>
procitus: <entryFree id="n38469" type="main" key="pro_ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from procieo.</entryFree>
proclamatio: <entryFree id="n38470" type="main" key="procla_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proclāmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <sense id="n38470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [proclamo]. </sense><sense id="n38470.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a calling out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crying out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outcry</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 8:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 8, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 18:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38470.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an appeal</hi> to a judge to assert one's liberty, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 12, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14" default="NO">14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34" default="NO">34</bibl>; 23.</sense></entryFree>
proclamator: <entryFree id="n38471" type="hapax" key="procla_ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proclāmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bawler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vociferator</hi>, said of a bad advocate: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim causidicum nescio quem neque proclamatorem aut rabulam hoc sermone nostro conquirimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit> Orell. (dub.; B. & K. clamatorem, ex conj. Ellendt).</sense></entryFree>
proclamo: <entryFree id="n38472" type="main" key="procla_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-clāmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to vociferate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38472.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">assunt, defendunt, proclamant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:42:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 42, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patre proclamante, se filiam jure caesam judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā proclamat voce Diores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 345</bibl></cit>: quid <cb n="PROC" /> non proclames, si, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:75" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38472.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in jurid. lang. </sense><sense id="n38472.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To defend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clamor in defence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proclamando pro sordidis hominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 26, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. proclamator).—</sense><sense id="n38472.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Proclamare ad or in libertatem, <hi rend="ital">to assert one's liberty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appeal to the judge to maintain one's liberty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:42" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 12, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:13:1" default="NO">40, 13, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ingenuitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:14:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 12, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:59" default="NO">40, 4, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procles: <entryFree id="n38473" type="main" key="Procles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Procles</orth>, <itype>is or i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*proklh=s</foreign>, <sense id="n38473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the twinbrother of Eurysthenes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of the Lacedœmonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
